name: The City of Freeport
description: Home of the overlord Lucan D'Lere and the citizens of Freeport

npcs.name: an academy scholar
utterances: I wish those guards would just leave us alone.
Was it just me, or did I hear something jingling in your coin purse?
Well, why didn't you say so!  That changes everything.
You have just the right amount of cunning to survive.
Oh, I bets you have quite a few nice shiny treasures, don't you?!
Once there was a time when we Teir'Dal were the true masters of Norrath.
This city is almost as glorious as Neriak, now.
I was never even near the bank.
There's no way they're better than us.  We have more.
Unless you know of a way to make some quick coin, we have no reason to talk.
Knowing the right people will keep you safe in this city.  The same could be said of the wrong people.

npcs.name: Administrator Frugi
utterances: This is the Temple of War, dedicated to the Hounds of War - Vallon, Tallon, and Sullon.  Pay proper respect!

npcs.name: Adrianna
utterances: I don't have time to fuss with these... things... right now.  The priests and priestesses of the Dismal Rage are very busy, and I am no exception.
Begone.  I have work to do, and you are in my way!

npcs.name: Aelia Catus
utterances: Hail, adventurer.  I'm glad you wandered into my shop.
You're looking for work from me?  You barely look suitable to beg for scraps on the street! What could you possibly offer me?  Hmm ... how well do your legs work and can you take a punch?

Hah! That attitude will serve you well around this district.  You'd better keep a strong sneer on your face when you're traveling on business for me.  I need you to give a merchant friend of mine a little reminder of a certain debt she owes.  If you're interested, I'll give you her name and location.  There may be a little coin in it for you, if you return with the response I'm looking for.

I've seen that look before.  You're going to prove to be quite handy after all.  Here, let me write down my friend's name and location for you.  You're looking for Julia Florens of the Jade Tiger's Den.  Just ask her when she's going to pay me.  Preface that with this: Any wrong answer will result in a visit from the Butcher.  Be sure to sneer during that part.  Hurry off now.  I'll be waiting on you.

npcs.name: Aemilia Sevso
utterances: Be careful what you touch in here. You're liable to kill us all!
Poison testers, it's been my biggest seller for the past several months.  Of course poison was a close second.
I need to get some eye of griffin, a bear's paw, the heart of an innocent man.  That'll be tough in this city!

npcs.name: Aezaar the Damned
utterances: Hello!  Such a mischievous day, is it not?

npcs.name: Agamennus
utterances: Alright, all right.  I'll see what we have on the market now.
Well, I can see what sort of goods we have available now.  You do have the proper scrollwork for all of this merchandise, correct?
Looking for anything in particular today?  Well, let's just see what we have for sale in the city then, shall we?

npcs.name: Aimee
utterances: Ratongas should never have come outs from the Underfoots, is too depressing out heres

npcs.name: Alethea Augustine
utterances: A Scholar is rarely without demand for work.  I have a work order which we could use some help with. When you're ready to begin, just take the invoice from the work order clipboard or work order desk.

npcs.name: Alexandria Tal`Azroth
utterances: Hello. It's nice to meet you, stranger. I've been waiting for news of my brother. I haven't heard from him in a very long time and I fear the worst.

npcs.name: Alypia Damian
utterances: The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Ambassador Brutus
utterances: Greetings!  I am here to offer assistance if you wish to change citizenship.  Is this of interest to you?

As you're probably aware, Freeport has established good relations with the cities of Neriak and Gorowyn, and when someone wishes to switch citizenship to these cities we try to make the process as friendly as possible. Is this your wish?
I would be happy to help.  Are you interested in becoming a citizen of Neriak, or Gorowyn?

Certainly! Here are your transfer of citizenship papers.  Simply travel to Gorowyn and present them to Ambassador Zekzekla near the guild registrar.  She will handle the rest.  Safe travels, and remember you are always free to visit Freeport.

npcs.name: Ambassador Erazak
utterances: I am the cultural attaché for the city of Gorowyn.  If you have any questions regarding a change of residency, please speak with Ambassador Zrelach.

npcs.name: Ambassador Zrelach
utterances: I am the emissary from Gorowyn, you may call me Ambassador Zrelach.
Gorowyn is a place of beauty. Forged within the depths of an ancient, dormant volcano, she thrives and thrums with the beat of our proud people.

I can arrange for that, yes. I will be most pleased to grant you papers allowing you to live in our city. All that will be required is that you have the papers stamped and signed by Ambassador Godwin, Freeport's emissary to Gorowyn.

npcs.name: Amulius Sarrius
utterances: The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: Amund MacRae
utterances: How's it goin'?
Listen, I already paid what I owe, that game weren't fair... wait... who'd you say?
Oh!  I heard that goddess was a hot one!  Pro'lly looked twice as good as one of them serving fillies at the tavern.  And those girls can make you howl!
If I ain't out slicing some beast with me axe, that's where you'll find me.  Cards, ale, and fillies –can't get better than that!

npcs.name: Annabelle Lekter
utterances: Grab an illusion and join the fun!

npcs.name: Annia Kaeso
utterances: Hello.  Hello.  Welcome.  You look out of place here in Freeport.  Almost as if you were something blown in by the wind or swept ashore by the tide.  No wait.  It was that dream!

npcs.name: Arabella F'arquharson
utterances: Want to give up your Jadeite Medallions? I got goodies!
Arabella, at your service!

npcs.name: Archbishop Haleim Felmease
utterances: Allow me to greet you in the name of our mighty Overlord, Lucan.  It is through his leadership and wisdom that the walls of Freeport are kept standing, and that our enemies are kept at bay.

And why shouldn't I?  Is it not clear that powers beyond this world flow through him?  Remember that in the absence of the gods, Lucan D'Lere rebuilt this city and made it into a beacon of salvation for those who would otherwise had been lost during the Age of Cataclysms.

You border on treasonous statements, and you are lucky none of his Lucanic Knights are nearby.  Of COURSE the city fell into chaos.  The Overlord is the one who maintains the order of Freeport.  None can replace him here – we have all seen what happens when Lucan is no longer here to watch over the city.
Ah, and that is a story of his unparalleled wisdom.

When Lucan D'Lere returned to Freeport after his absence, one of the first things he recognized is that his city was comprised of a people whose will was close to broken.  Their faith was strained, and they had no guidance.  Their resentment was growing.

Of course he could – Freeport belongs to Lucan D'Lere alone.  But further oppression of an already breaking people could lead to revolt.  Freeport did not need back-to-back incursions, especially not one in the middle of rebuilding from the last one.  No, the answer was not brute force.

He reasoned that the people needed to have their faith renewed.  That by showing them that he and he alone would care for and look after him, showing them that his strength was their strength, and that he was the one true leader of Freeport, he might quell any insurrection that could be brewing.

Lost sheep need a shepherd.  They crave the direction, the security that comes with having someone show them the path they need to take.  Guidance is what they need for comfort.  Appeal to the part of them that is broken – their faith.  Repair that, and they will follow you anywhere, even unto death.

Not the inquisitors.  They are practitioners of divine power, and see to it that the will of those powers is carried out.  While the inquisitors are certainly examples of faith to be followed here in Freeport, in this case, their methodology of enforcement was not appropriate for what needed to be done.  It was possible that the populace would view it as another form of oppression.

It was necessary to preach to the people in a way that brought them to believe the word for themselves.  Rather than force them to see the power and strength of Lucan, evangelize his accomplishments, and allow them to see them for themselves.  Once they have their own belief, they become easier to herd into the flock.

We did.  We moved among the people, offering food and aid in Lucan's name.  We have stood on the corners of the streets, preaching of his deeds, and conducting sermons for all to see.  Almost immediately, we could see the dissension fading, and saw the people respond favorably.  Thus, our order was born.

We are the Templars of Freeport.  We are his evangelists, his martyrs, the ones who preach his word to all that will listen. While the inquisitors enforce his will, we cultivate it, and bring the flock in under his name.  Sometimes the best method of enforcement, is to convince others that there is no enforcement.

We are.  Many have approached us to dedicate themselves to Lucan, to spread his word, and to represent Freeport and the gods we follow.  Through our faith and conviction, we will help ensure that Freeport remains strong from the inside out.

npcs.name: Archivist Jindlefog
utterances: At last!  Someone who recognizes my refined upbringing and overabundance of natural qualities.  Arise, humble servant!  Here we are all loyal subjects of the Overlord.

I'm afraid I've taught you all I know.  The Academy thanks you for your continued service!  You must seek out Paragon Jalex within these walls, as he can further your instruction.  It's rumored he was once a student of the Foci!

npcs.name: Ardath Bay
utterances: Grab an illusion and join the fun!

npcs.name: Aric Pickhall
utterances: May your path be clear, friend.

npcs.name: Armormaster Ikthar Icehammer
utterances: What can I do to convince you to walk out of here with that plate mail suit you've been checking out?
Would you like to see all of the colors that the suits come in?  I think we have a lavender leather suit in the back.
You can always go with the chain over the vanguard.  It's cheaper, but tell me, will you buy yourself a new life?

npcs.name: Asbjorn Greyaxe
utterances: Take my advice, drink the hard stuff.  That way you'll get sick from the drink, not the filthy stein they serve it in.

npcs.name: an assassin
utterances: Attack!
You should have changed out of your robe, Thexian!
That's the one!  They have the stink of Thexian arcanum all about them!
The informant was right, it's a Thexian!

npcs.name: Atianoo Donicus
utterances: You might have done differently, had you been in my shoes, but then we'll never really know.  Will we?

npcs.name: Atria Silana
utterances: Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!

npcs.name: Attendant Mell
utterances: Find the familiars! They can be of great use to you.

npcs.name: Attendant Teyvia
utterances: I'm eager to get back and help rebuild the keep. The mission of the Conservatory must continue!

npcs.name: Augurer Valgus
utterances: Your strength is the heart of Freeport, citizen.

npcs.name: Aulus Crispian
utterances: Welcome to Torlig's Herbs and Potions.  I sell many magicial reagents and herbs.  But, I warn you, you must possess amazing skill to handle them properly.

Of course I do.  I'm very knowledgeable in the ways of magic.  Why, if it wasn't for those instructors at the Academy denying my admission, I'd be on my way to becoming a famous arch mage! That fire was not my fault!

npcs.name: an awestruck Freeport dweller
utterances: Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, the Overlord would save us.
Let the weak Qeynosians rot.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
See! We never needed Qeynos' help! The Overlord can do it all on his own!
Those who wish Freeport to fall are fools! Let Bertox take them.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
We owe the Overlord a great deal.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Freeport still stands.
We must not doubt our Overlord. We owe much to his leadership!
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Freeport can't accomplish!

npcs.name: Azreana
utterances: You could learn something from the teachings of Erud.

npcs.name: Banker Gavius Herenus
utterances: No beggars and no solicitors.  If you don't have business to conduct then stand aside!
What services are you interested in, citizen?
Ouch, that's your balance?

npcs.name: Banker Lusius Ulixes
utterances: Hi.  The Overlord provides for us all, doesn't he?  I have a full range of banking services I can offer.  I just need to know your guild affiliation first.

npcs.name: Banker Macrinus Sanctus
utterances: No beggars and no solicitors.  If you don't have business to conduct then stand aside!
What services are you interested in, citizen?
Ouch, that's your balance?

npcs.name: Banker Magia Cotta
utterances: Welcome to the Freeport Reserve, Freeport's finest banking institution.  Our vaults are as secure as The Overlord's sanctum, with magical wards and runes inscribed by the masters of the Academy of Arcane Science themselves.  How can I help you?

npcs.name: Barber Razorburn
utterances: Snippy snippy!  Clippy Clippy!
Hair choppy now?!

npcs.name: Barber Whiskerwuzzle
utterances: Hey you!  Scruffy!  Get over here!  You could use some work done!
Got a hot date?  Ya need ta get yerself fixed up!
So ya want ta hide from someone huh?  Hey, it's none o' my business... Just curious...

npcs.name: Bard Loganius
utterances: Hello, friend. Care for a song while you relax? Just a small donation and Zagat and myself will make your stay much more enjoyable.

npcs.name: Bargiss Ranlor
utterances: Can't you see I am busy waiting on my order? Leave me alone. I came here to eat not to talk. Oh, here comes my order now. 'Bout time, the service here is the worst!

npcs.name: Barrius Iacomus
utterances: Ahoy!  Welcome to the Seafarer's Roost.  Name's Barrius, but all these scallywags just call me Bar.  Be sure to mind your manners.  I don't want any more trouble!

npcs.name: a Beggar's Court watchguard
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.
Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!
Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?

npcs.name: Beldrin Findlebolt
utterances: Hail to you, <player name>.
Oh, what's it to be?  Looking to get some mechanical contraption to work again, or is it something new to be cobbled and crafted?
You're not here to hire me for my services?  I am a grand tinkerer.  I can make any mysterious what's-it work again!
Besides tinkering?  Uh... I love good food!  Tinkering is very difficult on an empty stomach.

npcs.name: Belimee Viperwing
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Bellut Shortsong
utterances: Yep, <player name> what can I do for ya?
Ah!  Tis' a wonderful story! During my time apprenticing with the gearmasters at the Temple Street, I found the song of the cogworks!
The beats of ticks, clicks and pops knitted into music, and as such, it could be used to effect the actions of others!
It sure does!  The beat of my internal clock insures that I am never without the song of the cogworks!

npcs.name: Bendl Fizztuzzle
utterances: Hey!  I see you found your way into my bar.  Now don't take up a seat if you ain't gonna drink!  Ain't that right, Jetsam?
Judging by your looks, I'd say you drink that foofoo elvish wine, don't you?  Well, we don't sell that garbage here!  We only sell stuff that puts hair on your chest, like Fizztuzzle Whiskey!

You hear that, Jetsam?  Our friend here wants to know if the whiskey is any good.  Everyone who's had Fizztuzzle Whiskey can't say enough good things about it!  I've not had one complaint about it.  Jetsam makes sure they have only good things to say, if you catch my drift.  I know you'll like it.

npcs.name: Blerrkt Marrowdrinker
utterances: What brings you to the Temple of War, <player name>?

npcs.name: Blight Sage Destroz
utterances: By Bristlebane's pickled breath! The prophecy foretold at long last has come true! Freeport's shining savior stands before us! You have proven your worth, and now you must seek the forbidden within these walls. Only by understanding our enemy will you be able to defeat our foes!
Insolent swine! For this impudence I should slice open your belly and roast your entrails on a spit.  Do not dare to interrupt my private meditations again!

npcs.name: Boatswain Fomas
utterances: You have done a fine job.  The officers have taken notice, and no longer consider you a bilge rat.  Speak to Marauder Kindolus when you have a moment.  He's upstairs. You'll be reporting to him from now on.  Smooth sailing, friend. You're one of us now!
What are you looking at?  This ship is for pirates and cutthroats; lily-livered landlubbers aren't allowed in here!

npcs.name: Boddy Runewick
utterances: Humble apologies, sir!

My Bootstrutter's Field Guide mentions a second building very similar to Zarvonn's tower. As soon as I graduate, I aim to find that second tower! Who knows? Maybe I'll find Jusathorn's long-lost spellbook!
Is it true that Dolon Cogshimmer made an illusion of the Overlord?  I wonder what happened to him…

npcs.name: a Bonebreaker Champion
utterances: Who needs brain power when you have brawn power!
You don't want any of the champ!
If I can beat all of the other champions... I can enter the gymnasium.

npcs.name: Boomba
utterances: I am Boomba, and I sell pickles.  If you want to talk, find a Teir'Dal.
You dare insult me? Thank your gods a guard is over there. Once he stops looking at us, I plan on cleaving your skull in two.

I'm from a proud line of Boombas. My greatest grand-sire sold pickles at this spot more than five hundreds years ago. Every generation of Boomba has given their firstborn the name of Boomba to honor our greatest ancestor. When I die, my daughter, Boomba, will take my place. I'm tired of talking. Purchase a pickle or leave!

npcs.name: B'Rak
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Brand Narson
utterances: Quiet, you'll scare the fish.

npcs.name: Brenin Stoutheart
utterances: What do you want, <player name>?
I would be wary answering about my past, since such information used to be a commodity back in the Court.
Beggar's Court of course, where I was raised and trained. I was once one of the nameless rabble of the court until I was pulled from the streets and trained with arms and armor.
I was perhaps... fourteen when they took me. I now seek coin to pay back those that saved me from a beggar's life.

npcs.name: a brightened Freeport dweller
utterances: I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Let the weak Qeynosians rot.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
Luclin shines so bright...
We owe the Overlord a great deal.
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, the Overlord would save us.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
See! We never needed Qeynos' help! The Overlord can do it all on his own!
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Freeport can't accomplish!
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Freeport still stands.
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
Those who wish Freeport to fall are fools! Let Bertox take them.
We must not doubt our Overlord. We owe much to his leadership!

npcs.name: Brinegaggle
utterances: The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!

npcs.name: Broll
utterances: Man do I love gnome bread!  The trolls, they just love gnomes period!
Hey do you see any water around here?  Oh well, who needs to wash their hands?
The Ogre bread takes an extra long time to bake.  Hey, they like large servings.

npcs.name: Bronson Thewlis
utterances: Imagine the indignity of being stuck looking like an aviak for the rest of your life.  This professor Jusathorn must have had a very strong mind.
I think coercers lack the imagination to be illusionists.

npcs.name: Bruccius Capito
utterances: Helloo there!  Can you feel it?  The wind is changing direction....

npcs.name: Bruise Hotep
utterances: I've got a treat for ya!  Ha!  Ha!  Ha!

npcs.name: B'Ryk
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Bullseye
utterances: Ahhhhh!
The things a gnome has to do for research funding!
I did not sign up for ANY of this!

npcs.name: Caius Callidus
utterances: A Scholar is rarely without demand for work.  I have a work order which we could use some help with. When you're ready to begin, just take the invoice from the work order clipboard or work order desk.
I'm sorry, until you have chosen a specialty in your craft I do not have any work orders for you.  Come see me when you're more practiced in your trade.

npcs.name: Caltuur
utterances: Don't be fooled.  Although on the surface, Freeport seems calm, there are battles that rage around us.  Be mindful.

npcs.name: Captain Rillian
utterances: Unless you have a trade manifest that needs approval, I need you to keep moving.  All hail the Overlord!

npcs.name: Captain Siren
utterances: Stay out of the Seafury Buccaneer's way, and you'll have nothing to worry about.

npcs.name: Captain Vrondell
utterances: You dare to approach a militia captain without being summoned? State your business or move along!

Well done, citizen.  The dervish cutthroats have been profiting from our city without the penalty of taxes or loyalty to the Overlord for far too long. These sashes can be used to infiltrate their ranks.
The dervish cutthroats are comprised of bloodthirsty bandits bound to no law. They take any man or beast capable of slitting a throat.
They say they listen to one man only, their leader, a mysterious dark elf rogue known only as the Highwayman. This elf has enough power and charisma to charm any lawless scoundrel.

Your contribution is one of duty and obligation and does not merit compensation. However, as we understand your need for supplies and repairs to remain a productive member of society, I reward you your bounty.
Any scoundrel could spill blood, but we are citizens of Freeport not scoundrels. Spilling orcish blood for the defense of Freeport is an honor. Be thankful for serving the Overlord.

npcs.name: Chloe Misfortune
utterances: No need ta be nosey! I'm jes mindin' me own business here...

npcs.name: Cipius Abito
utterances: Hail to ye.  Are you interested in some groceries?  Real fresh like.  High quality goods at low prices.

npcs.name: Clan Chief Malachi Sleetsaber
utterances: Watch what troubles ya find, or find you in this great city.  A back is a fine place to sheathe an axe!

npcs.name: Claudette Woodbridge
utterances: The blessings of Tunare can be felt all around us, even in this cold land!

npcs.name: Claudia Quarto
utterances: My, my!  Another warlock within our midst.  Do not worry; I do not consider you a threat.

If you find items that add to your intelligence or stamina, then take them!  Intelligence affects your spell focus and increases the damage your spells can cause.  Your stamina affects your health.  This is crucial.
We are masters of death and decay, inflicting poison and disease upon those that dare to challenge us, particularly on groups of opponents.
There are other adventuring classes that must rely on strong defenses to survive, but we focus on the offense.  No need to defend yourself from a foe who is writhing in pain, plagued with disease!

Who goes there?  Are you a true believer in the Powers?  Have you conviction enough to smite your enemies and empower your allies?  Only those who are worthy may touch these magical wares.  If you  dare defile them, then be gone!

npcs.name: Cleerie Germinas
utterances: <player name> I am sorries! I hear of things for you to help us with, but you needs more skill. Come sees me when you gain twenty seasonings.

npcs.name: Clodia Laeca
utterances: If you need supplies, you best get 'em now! My wares go quickly. Hurry over, traveler. You mustn't wait! Come now!

npcs.name: Coldain Tradeskill Apprentice
utterances: Hello there!  I notice an air of mastery around you.  Are you an experienced tradesman?
You already have my colleague working for you in your house.  If you wish to have me work for you instead, you will need to bring the contract you have to me so that we can replace it.

npcs.name: Collector Rattelis
utterances: Hello! If you happen to find the Cloak of Crystal Shards, Assassin Master's Cloak and Cloak of Runes upon your travels, please let me know. I'll make it worth your while!

npcs.name: Colt Longpier
utterances: Have we met?
Oh.  It's a little embarrassing, but I had asked for some dating advice some time back.  I guess that's why you're here.
Well, I have a bad temper, but don't worry; I only hit when I'm sober.  Ha ha ha!  No, seriously, I'm very much an outside guy.  Nights under the stars, hiking and sailing are rewarding activities.
I enjoy the camaraderie of both, but sometimes my empathy for animals gets in the way.  I can have such a soft spot for furry creatures.

npcs.name: Consternator Soulinus
utterances: I am busy. Maybe when I'm done with my current work I'll send for you. Until then, leave me be.

npcs.name: Convert Y`Ral
utterances: What a joyous day this must be for you!  Can you feel the strength of the gods as they call to you from afar?  I have sponsored you for membership into the Temple of War.  Seek out Occultist Levonicus when you are ready to accept this appointment.  Good luck, my friend!

npcs.name: Corporal Henk Rimebreaker
utterances: Keep your distance.

npcs.name: Corporal Sergius Mordanticus
utterances: Come to thank the Militia for keeping the city safe, have you?

npcs.name: Corsair G`kex
utterances: Speak quickly, scoundrel, or step aside, as I have little patience for babbling oafs.  Why do I even waste my time?  Get off our ship, now!

npcs.name: Cricks
utterances: Shh... if you have no business here, then be on your way.  I have no time for conversation.
Humph.  Very well then.  Yes, I was sent to find him.  And with my keen senses and contacts throughout the city, I was able to find out where he is now.
He is here, but touching him is not an option.  A group of wizards has surrounded him and is not allowing anyone to come near.  I am confident that I can find a way in though, given enough time.
If you are in such a hurry, why don't you just take care of it yourself, then?  I don't need to be hurried by the likes of you.

npcs.name: Crispina Carius
utterances: Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!

npcs.name: Dalal Akilia
utterances: Hello, good friend.  How can I be of service to ye?  Interested in buying an item?  My contacts allow me to get unbelievably low prices on almost any consignment item from anywhere in the world.

npcs.name: Darrget Xyl'mir
utterances: Ahh!! You are not the one I am looking for.  Why don't you go find something else to do?

Not that it is any of your business, but I am looking for the one known as Thumore, if you must know.  He was supposed to meet up with me here, and we were going to join up with the rest of the revelers for the Heroes' Festival.

I'm surprised anything gets by you, with your amazing grasp of the obvious.  No, he has not shown, and it has been several hours.  I even had a friend of mine, Cricks, see if he could locate Thumore and remind him that he was supposed to meet us here!
All I know is that he is not living up to his end of our bargain, and at this point, neither is Cricks.  I wonder... are you any more trustworthy than those two might be?
Excellent.  Why don't you see where those two disappeared to.  If you can find them and get them back here, perhaps I can find a way to pay you for your time.

npcs.name: Dawood Haidaar
utterances: I couldn't help but notice you were staring at Master Glimmadge's apprentices. Remarkable, isn't it? Their ardent devotion to Illusionary study would certainly impress the late Professor Jusathorn were he able to see them.
An unfamiliar sight to most citizens of this city, no doubt. It has been some time since the Illusionary field of Enchanting magic has been seen, much less practiced here in Freeport.

That is correct. Under the benevolent teachings of Romiak Jusathorn, several Academy mages honed the craft of glamors, figments, patterns and shadows. The late professor was an enchanter of considerable ability. It is said that his illusions were so vivid that absolutely no one could discern their immateriality.

Professor Jusathorn was once the Foci of the Academy of Arcane Science. Many considered him the last defender of the Academy's neutral stance in its teaching. He once said, "Think not of good or evil. Instead seek only facts. Doing so makes one more likely to achieve good rather than those who view the world through the distorted medium of their own selfish desires."

Unfortunately, the selfish desires of others are what ultimately cost him his life. When the Overlord drove out the Knights of Truth and the Priests of Marr during the Age of Turmoil, others seized upon the resulting tumult to further their own agendas.
While the Overlord and Xelha Nevagon were consolidating the military and religious factions within Freeport, Opal Darkbriar wasted no time in usurping control of the Academy from Foci Jusathorn.

Professor Jusathorn, along with those who opposed the dark arts, died in a devastating battle against Darkbriar and her sinister allies. The conflict caused considerable damage to the city and the Academy itself. When Darkbriar emerged victorious, it heralded a new age for the Academy of Arcane Science.

Yes. For many ages the practice of necromancy was strictly forbidden from being taught within the Academy. Now, with Opal Darkbriar established as the new Foci, such restrictions were removed. Necromancers, long hidden within the shadows and darkest recesses of Freeport, converged upon the Academy and established a new school devoted to the black arts.

None of them were thought to have survived the battle between Jusathorn and Darkbriar. With no one left to teach the art of Illusions, the knowledge was eventually forgotten. The curriculum of School of Enchantment became focused upon coercion and beguilement. Jusathorn's legacy was no more.

npcs.name: Deacon Danerous
utterances: I'll offer you one warning: Watch your step and your purse in Freeport. This city is full of questionable characters who would love to relieve you of your coin and your life. Now be on your way.

npcs.name: Decius Dekarn
utterances: I'm here to buy any of that old armor you may have from Dyric.  Don't worry, I'll give you a reasonable price for it.  I also have some new armor for sale if you are interested.

npcs.name: Derald Walldons
utterances: Freeport - built long ago by human hands, now stands as the pinnacle of civilization on Norrath.  Hail to the Overlord for his strength and vision in leading us here!
Hello, friend.  Welcome to the Overlord's city, the beacon of hope within all of Norrath - Freeport.

And to imagine, this was built by us humans in the past.  It is a testament to our power, to our perseverance, and to the will of the human race.  Without Freeport, civilization would have collapsed during the Age of Cataclysms.

When the other cities of the world were falling, it was Freeport that stood against the darkness, and ultimately, rose above it to provide a home for all of the refugees who lost their homes.  The other races might be stronger, smarter, or live longer, but it was a human city they came to in the end.

I'm glad you agree.  I have a few friends who are looking to recover many of the artifacts from our past, but have been running into some difficulty.  We've been looking for some helpful adventurers such as yourself to see if you can lend us some assistance.

Ah, eager to help!  This is good!  Then let me get you started.  Speak with Historian Velanie in the Academy of Arcane Science.  Many of our citizens here have lost some of their heritage, and it's up to us to help them get it back.

npcs.name: Desmera Risentide
utterances: Greetings.

npcs.name: Detrius Alider
utterances: Hail adventurer! Have you come to enter the Arena of the Gods?
The Arena of the Gods is a place between worlds where mortals can challenge the avatars of the gods that are willing to participate.
No, you cannot kill the gods. These are just their planar representations. In some cases they look similar to the gods but in some cases they do not.
The statue next to me has been imbued to transport you and your raid force to the Arena. I would not attempt to go alone as they are very powerful beings and should not be trifled with.

npcs.name: Dinaris Jounst
utterances: Yeah, what do ya' want?

npcs.name: Disciple Vlaix
utterances: The skill of the Swifttail Monks is unparalleled on Norrath.

npcs.name: a Dismal Rage adherent
utterances: You may thank me now for gracing you with my presence.
Oh yeah!  But why should I?
Was it just me, or did I hear something jingling in your coin purse?
Everyone knows the Teir'Dal are the true power within Freeport.
Poisoning is always an effective way of winning a debate.
Knowing the right people will keep you safe in this city.  The same could be said of the wrong people.
Steer clear of those Wraithguards.  That is, if you know what's good for you.
There's plenty coin to be made around here, particularly if you're not burdened with morals.
If you do it right, pain is the gift that keeps on giving.
Hey!  A deal is a deal.  Until a better one comes along.
I was never even near the bank.
Oh, I bets you have quite a few nice shiny treasures, don't you?!
I think you dropped something behind you.
I wish those guards would just leave us alone.

npcs.name: Douglas
utterances: So... You want to dance?

store.gamelink: \aITEM 1753523737 1115291674 0 0 0:Romantic Red and Gold Hanging Fairy Lights\/a

npcs.name: Drake Fallon
utterances: Unity in Lucan.

Yes, I've heard about you.  You've come to collect the matched set of three long swords I purchased from Sleeth, I'm sure.  I've some bad news for you, enforcer.  I only have one of the swords.  I gave the rest to my sons, and they're off fighting orcs in the Commonlands.
I suppose you can have it.  I'm an old man now, and don't need it. The sword was just something to remind me of my boys.
Unity in Lucan, <player name>.

npcs.name: Drund Mordgraahl Skullsprain
utterances: Commoner! You dare to speak so freely to a Drund in this place of reverence?! You best have good reason for this intrusion.
Are you? It seems the winds of war have brought us together, as I need assistance.
I've heard rumors of the discovery of Neriak's foreign quarter. Adventurers in the local tavern call it Fallen Gate.  I want you to go into this lost domain and look for something.

I've read historical accounts of a great artifact given to an ogre warlord during the Age of Cataclysms. This artifact was created for this ogre during a time of social change within the First Gate of Neriak.

The First Gate of Neriak is located deep beneath the surface world. A powerful arcane device was smuggled into the district where it unleashed a quake so massive that the caverns of the First Gate fell and sealed this place off from the living.

Ancient records state that ogres and trolls of the First Gate worshipped a lost deity. This was not long before the city's disappearance. When the great First Gate perished, so too did the secrets of this lost religion and their deity.
How can I know who the deity is if the religion died before it could leave Neriak?  The religion disappeared three centuries ago.

If this religion was followed by the dark elves or trolls alone, then I certainly wouldn't give spit about it.  But the records didn't say that dark elves and trolls worshipped this new deity; it said that ogres worshipped it.

Why do you think I'm not going down there myself?  Because I'm a coward?  I'm a scholar first and warrior second.  If I was certain of the religion's activity, then I would request the Drunds plan an expedition.

The artifact is a magical gong called the Gong of Uglan. It is said that dark elf blacksmiths crafted this artifact out of a magical alloy and rewarded it to the ogre warlord Uglan for a deed ... a mysterious deed.
Take this quill and papyrus. Should you find this gong, copy the runes written upon it. If these runes match those I found in ancient texts, then that shall warrant an expedition.

npcs.name: a drunk sailor
utterances: I've heard the Far Seas Trading Company no longer honors the Pact of Tserrin.
I'm beginning to miss those young adventurers running about town, solving everyone's problems. Good work is hard to find!
Admiral Killingholme left port on the Far Dasher a few days ago. The miserable blighter refused to tell me his ship's destination!
I don't know what to tell you, mate. If the Traders haven't found your brother by now, I'm afraid he's probably gone to the Hold of Prexus.
Captain Gullham and his men left port for the Outpost of the Overlord several moons ago. Neither he, nor his ship, the Callisto Prince, has been seen since!
It's been a long time since we've seen any refugees from the Outpost of the Overlord. Have they all been rescued?

npcs.name: Duccius Agorix
utterances: Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?
The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: Dyric Pire
utterances: I don't have time for you. I'm trying to work. If you need armor, find someone more suited to your ... taste.

npcs.name: Dyvll Ssavan
utterances: What brings you to the Temple of War, <player name>?

npcs.name: Dyymona K'Vexx
utterances: Deliver that missive to L'rak Ta'Wound at the Nerian embassy in Freeport.
I have no desire to speak to you, Haeth'Un.

npcs.name: Eamric Icefist
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
What do you want?
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Edesii
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
Ah, another assassin!  It is a dangerous profession that you have chosen, but well worth it.
Understand that it goes against my very nature to give away anything I consider a trade secret, but I can part with a few bits of wisdom.

Procure items that add to your agility or stamina, when you find them!  Agility affects both your ability to inflict damage and avoid taking damage from others.  Your stamina affects your health.  This is crucial.

Our most devastating attacks are sudden strikes to vital organs from a cover of darkness.  These opportunistic attacks performed under a cover of concealment surprises our target, thus giving them less chance to protect themselves.

Keep in mind that the majority of our attacks are positional, meaning you need to be behind or beside an opponent for that attack to work.  So you must be aware of situations in which there are multiple foes, as positional attacks are of little use when you're surrounded!
I suggest you employ a divide and conquer tactic, and cut them down as fast as possible.  And do not overlook the power of poisons, in any situation!

npcs.name: Elder Fleesa
utterances: I listen to the voices of the lost.  Even from the past, they are as loud as they once were.

npcs.name: Elguka the Oracle
utterances: The spirits speak to us, and one day we will hear them, and finally awaken once again.

npcs.name: Ellynottin Zookbiddle
utterances: Well, well <player name> what brings you to the Academy of Arcane Science?

npcs.name: Elma Lowe
utterances: Come in. Come in.  Welcome to the Jade Tiger's Den, the finest tavern in all of Freeport.  Feel free to browse our menu. I personally guarantee that we serve only the highest-quality food and brews.

npcs.name: Elrinn Darknor
utterances: Freeport will be restored. Our glory cannot be extinguished.

npcs.name: Emissary Midia
utterances: Only those truly loyal to the Overlord need speak to me!
You have time to help me yes? Help the Overlord yes?  Help yourself?  Yes!
Yes!  Yes!  Midia needs your help, yes!  You get me the bones, I get you a real job yes!  Yes!
Yes, you go to Nektulos and bring me bones from the skeletons!  Any skeletons will do, yes!  Bring them back, and I'll have a special task for you, yes!
You need to finish what you started, yes?
Fine job, yes!  You have done as I asked yes?  Now, I need you to do something special, yes?
Yes.  Go to Edgewater Drains and find a scroll, yes.  You'll know it is for you, yes!  Very important for the Overlord, yes!  Once you get it, you'll know what to do, yes!
Come back when you are stronger, yes?

npcs.name: an Enforcer Champion
utterances: The voice in my head... THEY SAY TO EAT YOU!

npcs.name: Enforcer Drulk
utterances: What do you want, little one?

npcs.name: Erasmo Crane
utterances: Hello, citizen. I'd love to chat, but I'm busy getting my ship ready for a short fishing trip.  If you'll excuse me...

npcs.name: Euphemius Granius
utterances: Move along, I have no time to speak with children.

npcs.name: Everett Splizen
utterances: The Arcane Academy needs novices, <player name>, but you'd be eaten alive at your present skill. Return after reaching your twentieth season, and perhaps they'll let you peek at their books.

npcs.name: Exmarch
utterances: Aye, ye peepin' bilge rat, that parrot on his arm be stuffed.
Lets me knows if'n ye sight a shark with a timber stuck a'tween his teeth.
Get all the cures 'ere fer yer fevers and scurvy.
Ye'll find the finest grub and grog 'ere, Cap'n.
Arrrr, matey! Ye be lookin' to go on account?
Yo-ho-ho! Now there be some booty that'll fetch more'n a piece o' eight.

npcs.name: Foci Tamara Paust
utterances: You are not one of my lifeless minions.  Move along!

npcs.name: Fonda
utterances: You do not currently own the Reforging Feature!

npcs.name: Forbidden Lore
utterances: Ha fool!  You are not ready for these teachings.  Just a mere glance upon these pages would burn the eyes from your sockets.  Return to me when you have purified your spirit and only then will you receive what you seek!

npcs.name: Foreman Asprenus
utterances: Before you go opening your mouth, remember that I'm a citizen of Freeport.  A rich one at that.

npcs.name: The Forgotten
utterances: We weren't expecting a delivery.
I am far less interested in what you're carrying, and more interested in you.  I hope to see you again, <player name>.  I hope to see you again soon.

npcs.name: a forlorn apparition
utterances: Where... is this? Who are you?
I don't... where is this?
Buried? Here? Oh... wait, yes. I remember. There was a... moment. A frightening moment. Or was it... anger? What was I feeling?
Grave? My... grave. My grave isn't here. I'm not... I'm not buried here.
I was driven out. I should be... home? Yes. That's it. I should be home, but something... else... took my place. Drove me here.
I can tell you, but you... you need the key. It is locked.
No... it isn't locked in the way you're thinking. It's... closed. Sealed. You need the key.
I was forced through. I think... I think she was trying to destroy me.
I can find it. It's in a city somewhere. Look for me. I'll seek it out and show you where it is.
Now you'll need to find the mansion.
My... my steed knows the way. I have told her you are coming. She will know, and she... will take you.

npcs.name: Frederick Kruhgar
utterances: Happy Nights of the Dead!

npcs.name: a Freeport conscript
utterances: Straying a bit, are we?
Hah! New around these parts?
Yes, yes, hello. I'm busy.
You thought you were so superior, and look who you come to for protection when things get rough.
It's a fine day for evil to flourish!
We'll rise again, and then nothing will stop us.
Oh, drat, I hope not. Oh, sorry, I thought you might have meant the weather.
A good rat is a dead rat.  Good thing you're not really a rat, eh?
In war there is no room for fear.
Armor could be useful. But I've never needed it.
Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.
The best dreams are the flashbacks of the battlefield.
I've lived this long thanks to my ability to kill.
Sharp teeth, the better to tear flesh with.
Make war not love.
Treat us badly in Neriak! I laugh now we in same spot!
Smart or not, you're in Freeport now.
You'll do nicely when we make our play.
One day, our lot will improve here.
Watch yerself, this city can be rough.
Nasty scars and boiled tar!  Warriors is what we are!
Tasty treats, lots of meats.

npcs.name: a Freeport denizen
utterances: You may thank me now for gracing you with my presence.
This city is almost as glorious as Neriak, now.
Once there was a time when we Teir'Dal were the true masters of Norrath.
Show your enemies the mercy they deserve: none.
I am in no way interested in that glittery thing you have.  I promise.
Was it just me, or did I hear something jingling in your coin purse?
You have just the right amount of cunning to survive.
You're destined to be a part of something big, of that I am sure.
Anyone who dares to disagree with me will feel the taste of my steel.
Oh, I bets you have quite a few nice shiny treasures, don't you?!
I wish those guards would just leave us alone.
Do you ever get the feeling someone is watching you?
Oh yeah!  But why should I?
Just do what the guards say and the beatings won't be so severe.
That looks like an awfully expensive pair of boots you have there, friend.
Keep to yourself and you just might make it through another day.
It was the Thexian Teir'Dal that caused the trouble in Freeport.  They need to be wiped out.
The Thexians are a group of simple-minded blood traitors!
Everyone knows the Teir'Dal are the true power within Freeport.
The Overlord be praised!  The splendor of this city has been restored.
There's plenty coin to be made around here, particularly if you're not burdened with morals.
You're lucky there are witnesses watching us right now.
Knowing the right people will keep you safe in this city.  The same could be said of the wrong people.
Steer clear of those Wraithguards.  That is, if you know what's good for you.
If I had another five or six ales, maybe I wouldn't mind talking to you.
If you're looking for trouble, I've got a whole fistful of it waiting for you.
Don't be afraid of what the fates have in store for you, young one.
I find things that haven't even been lost yet.
That rat snitch better watch her back tonight.
Even a blind ratonga can feel the warm glow of gold.
Never ask when you can just take.
Bribery is useful tool!  Best you remember that in your adventures.
I see a great potential in you, young one.

npcs.name: a Freeport dweller
utterances: Do you have any body parts you don't need?
Just do what the guards say and the beatings won't be so severe.
If you know what's good for you, you didn't see anything, got it?
Keep to yourself and you just might make it through another day.
That looks like an awfully expensive pair of boots you have there, friend.
I hope you kill some good person today!
You figured out something that never happened, and so it's all lies!
Bribery is useful tool!  Best you remember that in your adventures.
The Overlord be praised!  The splendor of this city has been restored.
Darn.  I thought you was tasty morsel.  Hmmm... Maybe you are, yes?

npcs.name: a Freeport gladiator
utterances: There is nothing finer than a freshly bloodied battlefield.
You'd be surprised how easily skulls burst in my fist.
Step right up, if you'd like your skull bashed in.
I'd keep to yourself more if you plan on living out the day.
You should have seen him after I broke his back by bending him in half.
Watch yourself, young cub.  This isn't the safest place, despite its appearance.
You don't look strong enough to pull the arms off a goblin.
Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.
Sharp teeth, the better to tear flesh with.
If you know what's good for you, you didn't see anything, got it?
That looks like an awfully expensive pair of boots you have there, friend.
If you're looking for trouble, I've got a whole fistful of it waiting for you.
If I had another five or six ales, maybe I wouldn't mind talking to you.
Keep to yourself and you just might make it through another day.
The Overlord knows the strength of the ogres; I'd enjoy reminding the others around here.

npcs.name: a Freeport resident
utterances: Does anyone in this city bathe?
This city is almost as glorious as Neriak, now.
I travel. As long as it's to inflict pain.
This is truly a city to be proud of!
If you know what's good for you, you didn't see anything, got it?
Don't try to make a lady out of me and I won't try to make one out of you.
All of Freeport needs to be grateful toward the Overlord for what he has done for us.
Revel in the bloodshed.
Smite your enemies with no mercy.
Was it just me, or did I hear something jingling in your coin purse?
Watch your step. I'm not forgiving.
That looks like an awfully expensive pair of boots you have there, friend.
You'd be surprised how easily skulls burst in my fist.
There's plenty coin to be made around here, particularly if you're not burdened with morals.
Steer clear of those Wraithguards.  That is, if you know what's good for you.
The next time that guy leers at me, I'm gonna punch him in the throat.
If you're looking for trouble, I've got a whole fistful of it waiting for you.
Everyone knows the Teir'Dal are the true power within Freeport.
Poisoning is always an effective way of winning a debate.
Who do those Iksar think they are?  There will be a reckoning one day, I swear.
Unless you know of a way to make some quick coin, we have no reason to talk.
You can avoid trouble around here as long as you don't make eye contact with anyone.
If ever a Wraithguard calls upon you, I suggest you do not hesitate to comply.
The Thexians are a group of simple-minded blood traitors!
What I would give to strike down a Feir'Dal in battle.
If you do it right, pain is the gift that keeps on giving.
You may thank me now for gracing you with my presence.
I am sickened by the lack of amenities within this city.
I'd keep to yourself more if you plan on living out the day.
You should have seen him after I broke his back by bending him in half.
There is never enough bloodshed in this city.
Show your enemies the mercy they deserve: none.
Knowing the right people will keep you safe in this city.  The same could be said of the wrong people.
The Overlord be praised!  The splendor of this city has been restored.
You're lucky there are witnesses watching us right now.
Make war not love.
In war there is no room for fear.
I've lived this long thanks to my ability to kill.
Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.
Sharp teeth, the better to tear flesh with.
Only the strong survive around here.  Nice knowing you.
The best dreams are the flashbacks of the battlefield.
Armor could be useful. But I've never needed it.
I see a great potential in you, young one.

npcs.name: a Freeport visitant
utterances: Hah! New around these parts?
One day, our lot will improve here.
You thought you were so superior, and look who you come to for protection when things get rough.
Yes, yes, hello. I'm busy.
Oh, drat, I hope not. Oh, sorry, I thought you might have meant the weather.
Watch yerself, this city can be rough.
The best dreams are the flashbacks of the battlefield.
I've lived this long thanks to my ability to kill.
In war there is no room for fear.
Make war not love.
Straying a bit, are we?
I've already made my tribute to the Overlord this week.
Armor could be useful. But I've never needed it.
Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.
One day, we shall reign supreme over the lessers.
Grim determination has gotten us to where we are now.

npcs.name: Fryda Brushwuttle
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!

npcs.name: Gadko
utterances: Gadko takes old Vassi armor and sell you new armor, yes?  Come, come then! Gadko no like to waste time!

npcs.name: Galla Silverring
utterances: There is no freedom like being on the open sea, feeling the wind on your face and ship beneath your feet.

npcs.name: Galluss the First
utterances: Master Vlox's skill is unmatched.  Through his teachings, we will all grow stronger, and the legacy of the mighty Swifttail caste will continue on through us.

npcs.name: Gandy Gearlotta
utterances: Ahoy hoy, hero!  I hope you are enjoying this celebration.
Why, the fact that another year has come to pass since heroes began to arise to fight for glory and treasure; just as they did in ages long past.
Yes!  Would you like to share the festivities and participate in some of the fun?
The fireworks are my favorite part, as I am sure you can imagine.  Explosions, I tell you, they are good for the soul!
I know!  Take these Ro Candles and place them at the marked spots around the City of Freeport.  We'll get the entire city celebrating Heroes' Festival in no time!
Have you placed the entire case of Ro Candles around the city, <player name>?
I saw that last burst of fireworks all the way over here, <player name>.  Good job!

npcs.name: Gerhild Maclennan
utterances: Be on your way.  My work does not concern you.

npcs.name: Gevil Gigglegibber
utterances: Merry Frostfell to all!

npcs.name: Gh'lad Tydingz Gigglegibber
utterances: No free moment to say hail, during days of celebration.  So much to do, and so little time!  Much to do.  Yes, yes.
True, true.  Parties and gifts, decorations and food.  No time to gather!
Love it!  Yes, yes!  Gather for me some items that I need for the gifts I am making.  I write them down in your quest journal, and have special treat for you, when done.
Yay!  You good and brought items back for me to make more gifts.  You so good!  Now you take this as holiday treat for work done.
I can use more help if you got the time, or friend G'shugahplum may need a hand with his gifts, too.

npcs.name: a Gigglegibber Illusionist
utterances: Creepy ghoulies walk the streets!
More nights should be dead ones, like these!
Smells my feet!  Smells my feet!
Happy, happy Nights of the Dead to you!  You should join us and wander streets like creepy crawlies!
What I say confuses you in the head?
I magicks you to look like creepy crawlies, that's how!  Then you join fun!  You want?
Yes, yes!  Now you will look better.  Have good time, <player name>!

npcs.name: Gigglegibber Scalper
utterances: Want a ticket into the Haunted House? They're cheap...
Want a ticket?  It'll only cost you 5 silver!

Usually, I charge 5 silver... But you's look like an upstanding sort, so I'll give ya a chance to go in there for free this one time. You just remember that I's did this and you come back to me for all your Nights of the Dead needs.
You survived! Good job... You done real good. Here is your prize, come again.

npcs.name: Gimit Delerg
utterances: Oy there! *hic* Come ere' and have a drink wiff me. *hic* I promish I don't bite.
Oy! I'll leave when I am good and ready. *hic* And no little pansy is going to stop me.
I'd like to see ya try. *hic*
Aye, I hear ya! *hic* We'll take it outside then. *hic* I'll teach ya not get between a dwarf and his drink.
I've marked the spot on the map. *hic* I'll be there as soon as I finish this drink. *hic* "Ladies" first.
I'll show ya to mess wiff me and mai drink! *hic*
Alright! I give, I'll go back to work... Just let me lay on the ground for a while...

npcs.name: Ginny Boomsprocket
utterances: You look like you need help.  Can I help you find something?

npcs.name: Gisuka Voll
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Glaria
utterances: Hello, citizen.  You have nothing to fear from us.  In fact, we'd be happy to get to know you better, if you are ever willing.

npcs.name: Glimmadge Pilk
utterances: Cast first visualization!
There you are, Bronson. Very nice.
Cast second visualization!
Good form, Naltar.
Cast final visualization!
Boddy, you half-wit! Focus your mind and visualize your illusion before casting!
It’s said that Professor Romiak Jusathorn was held in the highest regard across all of Norrath, what I’d give for a journal of his to study!
Did you see those illusionary attempts the Academy’s coercers tried?  No?  Isn't it obvious why this school of magic is needed then?
When illusionists were purged from the Academy, it was very thorough. There are very few surviving records.

npcs.name: Golvana
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Gorga
utterances: In spite of the cost of living, it's still quite a popular item.
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Grabby Gigglegibber
utterances: I gives you candy corns for any treats you have found.  One stack of corns much easier to carry!
Yay!  You wanna trade me five of your Nights of Dead treats for five candy corns?  One type of candy be much easier stack in your bags.
Yay!  You wanna trade me one of your Nights of Dead treats for one candy corn?  One type of candy be much easier stack in your bags.
If you gets treats off creepy crawly or undead beasties, do let me know!
So much treats you carry!  I be trading all them for my candy corns.  Yucksy corn.
I be trading all Nights of Dead treats for my candy corns.  Yucksy corn.

npcs.name: Grand Duke Lazarus Hazran
utterances: Being kept safe doesn't stop some of these dim-witted citizens from getting their robes all up in a twist over our enforcement of law and order.
If people were still worrying about survival, then they wouldn't be riled up about laws, now would they?!

npcs.name: Grandmaster Kawayzer
utterances: Come see me later, I may have some work for you once you're more skilled in your trade.

npcs.name: Grum Zoomly
utterances: I don't want any trouble here in my bar, understand?  People really hate it when I get angry.

npcs.name: Gruurz
utterances: Grab me another pint if you're goin' to the bar.

npcs.name: G'shugahplum Gigglegibber
utterances: Shiny bits to share!  Help mes be gifty.  You feel warm-good when kaput the job.
Gifties not so done, but mes needs names of peoples to give pretties to.
Mes know who to give bits to, but names hard to pull out of head.  You find peoples' names.

npcs.name: Gustave Roberts
utterances: We can't wait forever for him.
What should we do? We are short a band member.

npcs.name: Haint
utterances: I've got your Nights of the Dead crafting goods!
Make yourself some creepy armor, or decorations for your crypt!

npcs.name: Handler Pachomius
utterances: "House trained?" What's that mean?
Just don't feed 'em after midnight.
This isn't a petting zoo. Either buy something or get lost.

npcs.name: Hargula
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Harn Greyrick
utterances: Unless you have urgent business with the Overlord, then go about your way.

npcs.name: Hazrulin Vextrik
utterances: I do not need your help. Begone.

npcs.name: Heartgar MacInnes
utterances: Your pockets need not be overflowing with different Erollisi notes or candy!  I'll help you consolidate them, if you wish.
You don't have any Erollisi love notes or hard candy, but when you get some, I'll trade you for them!

You may find love notes or candy on sentient creatures throughout Norrath during Erollisi Day, but you'll find even more of them in Shard of Love: Weeding Corruption, Shard of Love: Seeding Corruption, and Nektropos Castle: Love's Errand.
They can be used for crafting, sold to others, or exchanged with Liannya Heartswell for Erollisi Coin, a special event currency required to purchase Erollisi Day gifts from Douglas and Steven.
I'm willing to exchange any Erollisi Day candy or love notes you may get.
If you find any love notes or candy while you're adventuring, be sure to let me know!

npcs.name: a Heroes' Festival celebrator
utterances: These are some amazing times we are living in, to be sure!
Raise a pint for the heroes who have come before you!
This truly is the Age of Destiny!
It's hard to believe that another year of adventuring has gone by.
You should speak with Dalhya Felshire and take part in more of the festivities!
Come, and celebrate our heroes, whether they be in the Ethernere or upon Norrath!
Now is the time to recognize adventurers, one and all!

npcs.name: Historian Velanie
utterances: Please do not disturb me.  I have matters to attend to.
I don't think he knew how literal the task was going to be when he sent you.

As you know, humans built this city, and maintained it for many years.  Sure, other cultures moved into our walls and added their own talents where possible.  It was humans, and ultimately Lucan D'Lere, who showed the world unity when it shattered.

As correct as you are, it seems others would have us forget our heritage.  You see, a few weeks ago, we recovered a group of artifacts from the Age of War from the Commonlands.  We suspect they've been stolen to sell in the underground market, and we want to recover them before that happens.

I can't be certain, but we think that they are attempting to smuggle them out of the city in shipments meant for our allies.  Those shipments are waiting in Beggar's Court.  Search through the crates there, and perhaps you will find something.

npcs.name: Human Tradeskill Apprentice
utterances: Hello there!  I notice an air of mastery around you.  Are you an experienced tradesman?
You already have my colleague working for you in your house.  If you wish to have me work for you instead, you will need to bring the contract you have to me so that we can replace it.

npcs.name: Imaryn Yth`Dare
utterances: Hello!  Such a mischievous day, is it not?

npcs.name: Inim Candychewer
utterances: Hello, my friend. Are you here to learn about Frostfell?

Are you kidding? Frostfell is the most special-est, best-est time of the whole year! It's the most fun you've ever had! Everyone is happy and cheery and everyone loves everyone else! The first day of Frostfell is Kinship Day, and then there is Feasting Day, then the best day of all, Gifting Day and then there's Frostfell Day!
A long time ago, when everyone was sad and hungry, suddenly a lot of happiness and food just showed up at everyone's house. That's where Frostfell comes from.
That's all I care about.
What do you want to know?

npcs.name: Innkeeper Blerg Splinterthumb
utterances: Hello <player name>, I am the Innkeeper for this area. We have received word of your arrival and have a room prepared for you.  Would you like to know more about housing?
What would you like to know?
Many different kinds of housing are available in the City of Freeport.  In reward for your services, the Overlord has awarded you a one bedroom house for free at this time.

Yes, the grand City of Freeport has houses ranging from the basic two bedroom model on up to 5 bedroom apartments, although the most ostentatious of these are only available to the most prestigious citizens of the city.
Hello there <player name>, what can I help you with?

The marketboard is a house item, similar to books, beds, pets and other such items.  What sets the marketboard apart from the rest however is that once your marketboard is mounted on a wall in your home you can use it to sell items to other citizens of Freeport.  These items can be purchased by your fellow citizens at a Broker.  Brokers can be found in all primary districts of the city as well as in the Tradeskill wholesalers.

To place an item in your house you must first find the item in your inventory, once you have done so right-click on the item and select the ‘place’ option.  You will then see a tinted outline of your item in your house, when the item is highlighted green you may place it in that location, if it is highlighted red you cannot.
Selling through your market board works the same way as directly selling through a broker, it just allows you to do it from the comfort of your home.

Yes.  For a fee, brokers are willing to post the goods you are willing to sell to other adventurers.  Brokers can be found in all primary districts of the city as well as in the Tradeskill wholesalers.

You will find that your house has many uses, the first of which is the ability to store house items.  Each house has a limit to the number of house items you can place in it, so as you gain more possessions you wish to display you will need larger houses to do so.

Yes, houses have what we call vaults; these are extra storage within your house, the larger your house is, the more storage space available.  By placing items in this house vault and using your marketboard, you can sell these items to other citizens of Freeport without being in your room.

npcs.name: Intelligence Officer Rainus
utterances: Don't bother me now!  Emissary Millia just delivered a new set of reports I need to read over.

npcs.name: an investigator
utterances: Do not touch the sleeping one.  You might never wake again.
Waking the sleeping one is dangerous!  Keep your distance.

npcs.name: Iulus U`Vas
utterances: Hello.  Is there something I can do for you?

npcs.name: Izius J'lok
utterances: The power of the spirits can be used to strengthen all of Freeport.  Never forget that.

npcs.name: Izzay Meestere
utterances: They listens in to us.  It's only fair to listens to them.
Something is going on... but what?
What is the Militia doing this time?
It is sure ugly here!

npcs.name: Jabir Maridar
utterances: Eh ... what's that? Sorry, do you need something?

npcs.name: Jack Torrents
utterances: The ghouls that walk the city on this night are of no threat.

npcs.name: Jan MacGetz
utterances: Have a taste for fine steel, friend?  You'll not be disappointed in my stock.
Oh, yeah?  Unless you want me to call the guards, you'll remove yourself from my sight immediately.
Well, I'm here on behalf of the Coalition of Tradesfolke, and I take my orders from them.  You'll understand if I'm not interested in giving you anything but a fond farewell.
Hah.  I wouldn't be in business if I let every thug with aspirations push me around.  You do what you have to.  We'll see who comes out on top.

npcs.name: Jayson V'rhees
utterances: The ghouls that walk the city on this night are of no threat.
Grab an illusion and join the fun!

npcs.name: Jetsam Anchorwash
utterances: Eh?  What?  Get your dog breath out of my face and leave me to my ale!

npcs.name: Jezranaz Rottingskin
utterances: Curses, where is da doctor in the district?
Hmm, it's my locky for Gutrot.  He not been here for long time.  Is this all you bring me?
Well I not want it!  I knows what me look like!  What about the pretty ring me give Gutrot?  I can gets money for a ring.
Thanks for nothing then.  All's I gots now is a locky with me own picture. Blah!

npcs.name: Jojo Karanja
utterances: May the sun shine upon you. What can Jojo do for you today?
Ahh, Ferink. Riki, I do believe, is his lovely mother. Yes, yes. Nothing is more forgiving and pure than young love. It seems that Riki has forgotten that.
It seems I recall a time long ago when Riki's family was having trouble with the local orc savages. They were on the brink of moving when a traveler came to stay and do some work on their homestead.
Well, as it turns out, this kind fellow not only worked hard in their fields, but helped them fight back the orc scourge and rebuild some of their homes afterward.

Well, you see, as it turns out this kind fellow was also a kind feline. As Kerran as they come. It appears that Riki has forgotten that all people cannot be judged on the actions of few. Here, give her this necklace and ask her to remember Duia. That may help you, child.

npcs.name: Jonak Harvester
utterances: Greetings <player name>!  How are you enjoying your crafting career?

I can help you change to another crafting profession, but you will have to forget everything you know, and start again as a low level artisan.  All the recipes specific to your class that you've learned so far will be forgotten.
Hold still, this won't hurt a bit.
I'm sorry, my services are only available to those more advanced in the arts.
Good to hear.  Good day to you.

npcs.name: Joss Ridgemarr
utterances: Watch your back.  You'd be surprised how many blades fit perfectly there.

npcs.name: a Jubilation merchant
utterances: I've got plenty of items that are sure to delight you!

npcs.name: a Juggernaut taskmaster
utterances: The only business I have today is with a glorified champion. That rat will suffer for being late with the local chips.

npcs.name: Jules Jumsinger
utterances: I can handle all your banking needs, big or small.
What are you looking at, tallstuff?  Never seen a halfling in Freeport before?
Get on with your business or watch out for your ankles is all I'll say.
Welcome to the Coalition of Tradesfolke.  What's your business?

npcs.name: Julia Florens
utterances: Come in, please come in.  Welcome to the Jade Tiger's Den.  I'm Hostess Julia.   Perhaps you came to try a Jade Tiger cocktail?
Hey! No fighting in my pub. Take it outside!
Honey, if you have to ask it's not for you.

npcs.name: Jumpa-Lope
utterances: Snort?

npcs.name: Juvena
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.

npcs.name: Kaeso Polluvius
utterances: You looking for someone?

npcs.name: Kain Starkson
utterances: Oy, landlubber.  Why ye be leerin' at me like that?
O' course. Ye have nothing better ta do than harass an old salt.  Maybe ye can steal some cripple's crutches after this, or rob a beggar blind.
Were I younger, I'd cut yer hand off and feed it to the sharks for speakin' such! My days as a young spitfire be long past, though.  Here, take them.

npcs.name: Kal'ril Nightstalker
utterances: That shipment must be heavy.  Why don't you cop a squat and relax?
You think so?  It makes me a mite nervous when you're so uptight like that.  If calm isn't in your vocabulary, you can shove off.
There you go.  There's no reason to move so fast.  Just stop, take a deep breath of the sea air, and relax.  Enjoy what you've got, while you've got it.
Haha.  I think you and I are going to get along just fine, <player name>, despite what everyone else says about you.  Feel free to stop by and say hello anytime.
Tell Lasarian that he'll get his payment.  As long as he keeps us well-supplied and protected, the Tradesfolke will be up to their ears in goods and slaves.
I don't know.  Now that the flotsam and jetsam have been removed from the city, it just doesn't feel like home for me.
Those that go where the wind takes them can wind up lost at sea.  You seem like you've got both hands on the captain's wheel.
Don't look to me to be your next travel mate!
Hot day, isn't it?
I bet you've got some amazing tales laced with backstabbing and evil cunning.
I gotta get into the Militia.  Then I could legally beat up people.

npcs.name: Kanos X'aphon
utterances: You mean nothing to me, whelp. I seek one with ability enough to do my bidding.  Now, back out the door whence you came with your tail between your legs before I disembowel you and leave your entrails for the vermin infesting this filthy human city.

I've no problem sending you to your death, if you seek it so quickly.  Now, are you sure you possess the fortitude to attempt what I need done? Or are you just another simpering coward, emboldened by a sword in the hand and the delusion of your own greatness?

Then listen closely.  Attention to detail is essential.  I need a key to the Fallen Gate, and you're going to find one for me.  Too long have I been away from my home, and those foolish Thexian loyalists have finally found a way back into Neriak ... or at least, that's what my informants told me.

I've not invited you to ask questions! Hold your tongue.  I do not desire to see the Thex dynasty restored. I bear no love for those spineless worms.  I'm certain they're the reason Neriak fell in the first place.  What I do desire is to return to the halls of my birth with my bloody blade in hand and a prayer to Innoruuk on my lips.

As you can imagine, my views do not impress the Thexians.  Unfortunately, they are the only ones who have been able to reach the lost city.  I need you to pose as one interested in joining their cause.  You'll need to speak with Tundis N'oxyle near the gate the Thexians erected in the Commonlands.  Do not return until you have further information for me.

Perhaps you've more mettle than I gave you credit.  The common weakness of the trash who dwell in this city has jaded me to the possibility that some gutter filth are not completely worthless. If you've information, out with it.

Lucan himself could not have ordained a better time! You will go to this meeting.  Slaughter every Thexian you come across and take a key for yourself as well as one for me.  I will be along as soon as I am able. I have other matters to attend.  I'm willing to venture that you alone cannot complete this task.  I hope you have friends who are willing to assist...
Will it?  Very well. I'll lead you to the place, from there you're on your own. I've other interests to attend in the meantime.

npcs.name: Karila T'zel
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!

npcs.name: Keetra Morrow
utterances: Psst ... I'm cutting you in on the deal of a lifetime.
Of course we deliver! I'll just need an address, key, and the times when you won't be home.
Don't let these deals slip through your fingers.
This merchandise is so hot it's still warm to the touch.
With these values it's like you're the one committing highway robbery!
Well, well, what have we here?
Satisfaction is guaranteed, with all items fully refundable...if you can find me again.

npcs.name: Kell Glavitus
utterances: Greetings traveler, have you come seeking enlightenment into the path of transmuting and adorning?
Well then I hope that your studies are passing well.  Peace be with you! And remember, one traveler's junk is a transmuter's treasure!

npcs.name: Kenth Lanringe
utterances: We are here to support the citizenry of Freeport in all of their spiritual matters, just as the Overlord has commanded.

npcs.name: Kirsteh the Witch
utterances: Either you have the talent for magic or you don't.  It doesn't come without study and research ... and right now you're keeping me from both.  Please explain to me why I should waste any more time on you? Unless I can use you as a test subject...

You interrupted my research to make that kind of a proclamation?  I should rot the flesh from your bones just for fun!  But since you're brave enough to come seek me out, I suppose you can help me. I, however, do not hire apprentices. You will work for me, and I'll pay you with magical trinkets I have lying around.  Take it or leave it.

Let's start with something simple.  I'm always looking for new things to use in my experiments.  If you can find what I'm looking for, I'll make it more than worth your while.  Especially since my alternate plan was to use you in my research.
I'll ask you to leave before I lose my patience and turn your limbs into blackened withered stumps.

npcs.name: Krishana
utterances: I've got these fine scrolls for sale, do take a look at them.

npcs.name: Kroota Gukbutcher
utterances: Praise the Hounds of War!

npcs.name: Krung Ironfist
utterances: In spite of the cost of living, it's still quite a popular item.
Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Kurid T'Sal
utterances: What brings you to the hallowed halls of the Temple of War?

npcs.name: Kuzik Zozin
utterances: All of my work is art.  If you have something you want done, then you'll need to be willing to part with a lot of your coin.

npcs.name: Kybosh Clangsworthy
utterances: Greetings. I have the honor of being one of the first master tinkerers in a long time.  As you may know, tinkering is the process created by gnomes many centuries ago.  It was used to make the clockworks that served in the great city of Ak'Anon, as well as many devices that were used every day by tinkerers of old.
I hope that your studies are going well.  Good luck to you!

npcs.name: Lasarian Nasin
utterances: Any great civilization is not built in a day.
Have a seat.  I've been expecting you.
Sanura works for me.  You may already know this.  And by extension, you've been working for me, in an indirect but very real way.

You've become very profitable for me, and I'd like to keep our relationship mutually beneficial.  Some confusion is to be expected, so allow me to explain.  When Sanura is done refurbishing those weapons that you confiscated, they will make their way back into the hands of the Militia and other city groups.  From there, the excess will trickle down to city vendors.  From there, the weapons will be sold to citizens not unlike the ones you appropriated them from.

So, maybe you thought you were protecting the city, or you were caught up in the rhetoric of the Militia, or you were looking to line your own pockets.  Maybe you were trying to impress Serris.  From my perspective, your intentions were inconsequential.  You helped me, and I'm thankful.
