I want to make sure that you understand our relationship, and that it remains amicable.  You do me one little favor, and I'll consider us friends.  You decline, and I can't guarantee your safety.  It's a simple decision.

Your friends from the Militia have made it difficult for me to make good on a promise I've made.  Several Freeport citizens and businessmen are expecting a delivery of Rusty Ol' Hatchet Port, and I don't have enough to meet demands.  To solve this problem, I've watered down what little we had in stock.  You can deliver it for me, and hope the recipients don't notice.

If the buyers don't notice that the bottles have been tampered with, then all is well.  If they do notice, it's your fault; you'll have to fend for yourself.  Now, don't underestimate the fury of someone who realizes they're being cheated.
That watered-down wine's not going to deliver itself.
I heard through the grapevine that you managed to deliver all the bottles of Rusty Ol' Hatchet port, even when they didn't want it.

I will make sure the unhappy customers are compensated, and that they know the problem was not the fault of the Coalition of Tradesfolke.  So long as they believe that I was not responsible and that you were severely punished for this misdeed they will not hold a grudge.

No, we're not done.  Sanura brought me the weapons she'd processed and they need to be redistributed.  You started this process, so you might as well see it through to the end.  Don't worry, this time I'm not going to put you in harm's way.  All you have to do is see the weapons safely to their new owners.
Back already?  I heard you had some mishaps.

Listen to me well, <player name>.  Mishaps are like knives: they either serve us or cut us as we grasp them by the blade or the handle.  You are standing here, so you clearly handled this mishap appropriately.  Keep up the good work, and you'll do well for yourself in our city.
Now go do whatever it is that you do.  I'll call for you again if your services are required.
Mishaps are like knives: they either serve us or cut us as we grasp them by the blade or the handle.

npcs.name: Lerenth
utterances: Glory to the Overlord, citizen.  This is the perfect time to support Freeport.  Wouldn't you agree?

Just hear me out.  A month ago, I was nobody in this city.  Now I'm helping the Freeport Militia.  Things are going great.  I'm telling you: it won't be long before I'm a member of the Lucanic Knights!
No kidding.  Since Lucan returned, life in Freeport has never been better.

Stick with me.  There's no limit to how successful an able-bodied adventurer like you can be in Freeport - and I'll show you how.  I just need some help in culling the unsavory elements of the city.  Help me with my task, and you'll be rewarded just like I have.

npcs.name: Liannya Heartswell
utterances: I will gladly give you Erollisi coin for the love notes or message candies that you carry.
Do you really wish to exchange your love notes and message candies for Erollisi coin?  I promise the coin can be used by some of the celebratory merchants.
If you find any love notes or candy with messages upon them, do let me know!

npcs.name: Librarian Motius Feldarn
utterances: I can not waste what time I have on someone so inexperienced.
Come closer, my fellow student of the arcane.  How do your studies fare?

I am impressed by your confidence, <player name>.  I propose a test of your skills for the Academy of Arcane Science.  Surely, someone of your advanced prowess has nothing to fear from the simple tasks of target elimination or armament portage.

Splendid!  The armaments must be delivered clandestinely at magically marked locations within Stonestair Byway by an Erudite Mage.  The targets you are to eliminate are Kerran and also reside within Stonestair Byway.  It doesn't matter who, just as long as they are Kerran.
The arcane power held here within the Academy, is great.  But do not let it distract you from your current task within Stonestair Byway.  It is a matter of great import!

npcs.name: Librarian Zabnolique
utterances: Please be quick, I am very busy.

npcs.name: Liege Torn A`Adar
utterances: Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!
The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Dalling
utterances: Mind yourself, citizen.  There is little that escapes the notice of the Red Hoods.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Darrius
utterances: The militia has a task for you, citizen.  Will you accept the call to duty?
Our intelligence recently located a known enemy of the city, a Bloodskull officer named Ohrgran Foulgore. This beast is said to have ties to Freeport.
This orcish officer has successfully eluded all attempts to destroy him in the past.  He knows the militia's tactics far too well, making his existence all the more threatening to our city.

Ohrgran expects a military attack and would take flight before our soldiers invaded.  What he does not expect is a civilian strike.  Your tactics are unknown to him and your appearance would not alarm his scouts.

Our intelligence spotted Ohrgran's scouts coming and going from the south.  We know an encampment of orc soldiers has set up camp in this area. It's only fitting that Ohrgran would return to man his post there.
Nothing short of Ohrgran's head will prove the task's end.  What say you, citizen?  Are you a child fearful of death, or are you prepared to serve the city of Freeport?
Then you accept the task until Ohrgran's death or yours.  We expect your return as quickly as possible.  The militia does not tolerate unnecessary delays.
The militia is looking for volunteers. Do you think yourself strong enough to meet our expectations?
The militia needs citizens to gather intelligence on a possible orc outpost in the savannah.

The Overlord requires concrete evidence of an established enemy stronghold in the hills before he orders an invasion.  The intelligence you gather will prove or discredit the belief of an organized orc presence in that area.
We believe the outpost is inside the Wailing Hill.  The superstitious ramblings of the past generations have inspired fear of the region.  This fear makes the caverns a secluded, tactical location.

The Overlord will not divert resources on suspicion alone. We believe that citizens such as you are capable of accomplishing this task or perishing in the attempt.  Either way, the goals of Freeport will be served.

It is suspected that arcane casters play a key role in this outpost.  Rumor is they are spiritkeepers. The militia expects no less than five scalps from any orcish spiritkeeper in that region to be presented from each volunteer before their duty is fulfilled.

Volunteer duty does not come with the promise of wealth or praise! You should consider it an honor to serve the Overlord. Expecting compensation is as disgusting as it is insulting. Either you will volunteer for the post, or you will face the consequences of insubordination!
I'm glad that we have such ... loyal and willing citizens in our midst. You have pledged your assistance to the militia; be sure that you see this task through to its end, or you will meet yours.

Eh! A useless rusty dagger!? Not only is it rusted but it bears many scratches; it looks as if a giant rat clawed at it. Although I consider this evidence of no importance, I do owe you a reward for ridding us of that accursed orc.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Vesder
utterances: Be gone.  I don't care to deal with you.

npcs.name: Lil' Boo
utterances: Make yourself some creepy armor, or decorations for your crypt!
I've got your Nights of the Dead crafting goods!

npcs.name: Lirosi
utterances: Shouldn't you be out slaying a dragon or something? *hic*

npcs.name: Loche V'Lys
utterances: Yes, what is it?  Oh, another one of those adventurers.  If you've got any of that old armor from Kirsteh, give it here and I'll sell you some new armor.

npcs.name: Lollia Parnesius
utterances: Oh, hello there! Perhaps my eyes fail me, but you look like you're handy with a quill. Can you do some scribe work for me?

npcs.name: Londiar Inygad
utterances: Hello there!  Would you perhaps be able to assist us with some Tinkering, Transmuting, or Adorning tasks?

Thank you, we are always in need of thingamajigs.  Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.

I can teach you the basics, however you will want to visit the tinkering trainer on the docks of Butcherblock Mountains to learn more recipes.  While you're there, you can also learn more about adorning if you are interested.
Glad to hear it <player name>! Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Good day, friend.  Let me know if you take up the craft of adorning, I may have some work for you if so.

I will teach you the basics, however you will want to visit the adorning trainer on the docks of Butcherblock Mountains to learn more recipes.  While you're there, you can also learn more about tinkering if you are interested.
That's great <player name>! Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Fantastic, it should just take a moment to transmute these discarded guard boots?
Well, get on with it then, no time like the present!
Let's talk again when you are finished.
Remember to bring them back once you are done.

npcs.name: a lonely citizen
utterances: Leave me be. I wish to sulk alone.

npcs.name: The Lord of Dreams
utterances: <player name>, great hero of Norrath, you are being celebrated by this city this day! Your many accomplishments, including those not witnessed by living mortals, are being honored. Bask in these accolades, for they can be as fleeting as a dream.
Just returned from a daring challenge into Ethernere and now you stand before me, laden with arcane items. Thank you for them.
One of many who have devoted themselves to the power of dreams, but this is not his day, this is yours. Return to the celebration, and take this with you.

npcs.name: Lothaire Stormgazer
utterances: Hip hip hooray! Hip hip haroo! Celebrate the heroes; they've saved me and you!
Most people don't know... can't know how many times their lives have been saved by the great heroes of Norrath. No doubt, they'd be driven mad or at least have a crisis of significance.

Sure, and there are songs of great deeds, and great tales told by the bards and loreists, all extolling the virtues of the heroes. That's why all these people are celebrating, of course, but do they really know?
Aye. They couldn't possibly know all that's been sacrificed for everyone's lives and afterlife!
Yes! I was there. I was one of the souls who had been taken before their time, and who had been returned due to the actions of the great heroes.
I still dream of it, you know? My memories of Ethernere are still so vivid. Would you like to see it?

Share with you my memories? The mysteries of this world continue to astound, don't they? I simply ask that while you are there, that you do something I was not able to at the time; obtain several swatches of cryosilk.
You're back! That is spectacular! You truly are one of the heroes who deserve our celebration. But that is not all that I recall of Ethernere.
The Silver Reaper's castle. Step into my memory and get me two etherfused shards from the royal halls.
I knew you could do it, <player name>! Here you return, with the etherfused shards, as promised. Drinal's keep was quite a sight, wasn't it?
I have one last memory of Ethernere... but this one is less firm. It's hard for me to make out as many details, as if the edges of the memory have faded.
A colorless land, with wurms and their kin. Wings and world-shaking fury. If you dare enter this memory, I only ask you to return with filament of divine transcendence.

npcs.name: Lrak
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: L'rak Ta'Wound
utterances: Greetings, Teir'Dal, kin of Neriak!
Oh, a message!  Sometimes they hold horrific news.  Other times they are boring.
Yes.  May Her Grotesque Glorifiousness bless you!
May Her Grotesque Glorifiousness bless you!

npcs.name: L`Tor
utterances: The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Lucan D'Lere
utterances: For these reasons, and for this prisoner's crimes, I condemn the prisoner to death!
Be vigilant. As always, the pathetic queen of Qeynos has sent her spies to undermine our efforts. But the weak-willed Qeynosians are no match for the iron strength of Freeport.
My loyal citizens of Freeport, hear me!
This traitor is a Qeynosian sympathizer--an aid to those who would sow disorder in our city.
I need not remind you; we are superior to the Qeynosians in every way but one.
Our only flaw is complacency. But I urge you, loyal citizens, to be complacent no longer.
For the good of the city, for the might of Freeport and its people, we must not tolerate betrayal. We must remove this corrupting influence from our city.

npcs.name: Lucius Wavedancer
utterances: Good day, <player name>.  What brings you here this fine day?

npcs.name: Lynda Chemroot
utterances: We've all the basic supplies that you'll ever need.  Are you looking for anything specific?
You look like you need help.  Can I help you find something?

npcs.name: Lyricist Sha'son
utterances: The Chaos Orchestra revival has begun. Come one, come all!
A long long time ago... I can still remember. How the chaos used to make them smile.
We knew if we had only one chance, the lute could make the rabid dance and they would surely be happy for a while.
Although the lute made us coin, with every concert we delivered. Curses rest around beyond the door, we couldn't play one more chord.
So, farewell, farewell ayonic lie. Heard the fortunes of the troll, but the fortunes were dry. That would be the age the lute died.

npcs.name: Lyricist Te'naj
utterances: Support your local arts! Donations appreciated!

npcs.name: Lysndra
utterances: I do not need any help, adventurer.
Sorry, thought you were another lookin' for work.  Nothin' gets under my fur more than when people treat me like I can't provide for myself.  This girl's doin' it for herself!
Truth be told, I prefer it that way.  I never have known what to do with myself unless I'm active.  Even my hobbies keep my paws busy!

npcs.name: Maak
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Macia Victus
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Maldreya Darkheart
utterances: What business have you with the Dismal Rage?

npcs.name: Mallium
utterances: At the prices I'm going to offer you, friend, I should have the Militia arrest you on the spot for robbing me!
Looking for the best goods in the whole of Freeport?  Well, my friend, you've come to the right place!
Here is what the city has to offer, my friend.  If you have any questions at all about the stock, please don't hesitate to ask.
Don't worry, friend, if it's not on our lists then the goods do not exist.
I can only offer you what my contacts have been able to locate.  These are the best goods that the citizens have to offer.

npcs.name: Marauder Kindolus
utterances: Well, it seems you've been deemed worthy of trade in our organization.  My congratulations to you and your crew.  You need to speak to Corsair G`Kex over there.  You can't miss him -- he'll be the one standing upon the deck of a large vessel in port.  Good hunting! Until we meet again, friend...
What filth is this before me?  I've a schedule to keep and no time to associate with common trash.

npcs.name: Marcia Betto
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
Hello! Can I offer you one of our new lifetime extended warranties for any merchandise you purchase?

npcs.name: Mareva D'Iniv
utterances: Interested in earning a little prestige with the Overlord?

Wise choice.  I'm an archaeologist representing a coalition of groups that is interested in a recent...development.  I'm hiring some field workers.  While that sounds menial, trust me, the interest in this work is anything but.
He is interested in many things.  Our research will likely solve a new mystery concerning some ancient events.  Before I can give you any details, I need your oath of compliance.

The penalty for non-compliance can be rather severe, so see that you keep your oath.  The roekillik have reappeared and they are apparently surveying several different mines across the lands, including the Commonlands and the Thundering Steppes.  You need to find out where they are concentrated, and what they are seeking.

Some say they are ancient relations of the ratonga.  Who knows?  Our immediate concerns are: why they are here now, and what do they want?  Perhaps the answers to these questions will answer other questions as well.
Have you discovered what they are doing?
Who are the "investors" and what do they want?  Do I need to drag this information from you?
Failure does not interest me.  If you do not bring me information about these "investors," I shall be forced to inform the Overlord of your lack of trustworthiness.
I hope you actually have some information to relay.

Rare substances?  That does not sound like the drakota.  They are up to something.  I must confer with my colleagues.  Do not tell anyone else what you have learned.  Return to me later for further instructions.
Come closer!  What I have to say must remain a closely guarded secret.

My colleagues and I were very intrigued by your initial reports.  The Overlord himself sent word that this investigation is of the highest priority, now that the drakota are involved.  He wants us to learn more about the roekillik's search.

This is not about what I want or what you want: the Overlord directs you to learn what the drakota seek through these ratmen.  While at this point, we do not know what the drakota are after, you will interrogate the ratmen and convince them to cooperate.

By whatever means necessary.  Be cautious, however, that you do not reveal the true nature of your errand to the ratmen or to those conniving Qeynosians.  Whatever this artifact is, it is surely meant for the Overlord alone.

npcs.name: Marjorie Falconius
utterances: Oh, hello there!  What can I do for you?
Ah, I should have been expecting this.  Erollisi Day comes 'round and love is in the air, thick as my cinnamon hard bread!  Mmmmm!
I do!  It gives me a great excuse to bake frilly desserts and pastries.  Not that I need much reason, mind you!  I love cookin' and watching others enjoy my creations.
It's my trade and my hobby!  I take a lot of pride in my culinary skills.

npcs.name: Master Vlox
utterances: I have come to teach the way of the Swifttail Monks.  To bring the mastery of our discipline to those in Freeport, and to show the people of this land the strength of our art.

That is true, and has always been true.  Since it was originally taught by Grandmaster Tynn, the Swifttail Caste has taught the iksar to master their inner strength and the harmony of their body and spirit.  It is an honored tradition among the iksar, and is an order all iksar should be able to follow.

Since Kunark was once again discovered by the people of these lands, we began to not only hear stories of iksar who no longer lived in their ancestral homeland, but we actually met many of these few iksar who were not born there.  When they saw the ranks of the Swifttails in practice, we could see a longing in some of them.  A realization that they had found something they lost.
I have.  I was sent here to bring the Swifttail order back to those who have lost it.  I have come to teach the disciplines of inner harmony to the iksar here.

For generations, we have believed that only an iksar could ever be a Swifttail.  That, of course, is and will always be true.  To teach our art to those who could never fully master it would be nothing short of foolish, since they could never truly be one of us.

Because experience can change wisdom.  You see, since the discovery of our homeland, many monks from this part of the world have come to our training grounds, looking to complete the trails we laid before them.  We never expected any of them to pass, yet, occasionally, one would.

We found that these monks did possess a strength, much to our surprise.  While it might be true that a given student cannot be Swifttail, perhaps others could learn enough of our art to become a weapon in their own right.  We could show the people of this land the strength and superiority of our own order.
I have not spoken to the Overlord myself.  I had members of his Knights approach me, and threaten to toss me from the city, or straight into the dungeons.

I did not have to do anything.  When I came here, I brought with me a letter from the one who sent me.  He had predicted that there might be conflict with my being here, and teaching our discipline within Freeport's walls.  Thus, he composed a message for the Overlord, and ordered that I present it if needed.

I was sent here by Dominus Rile.  When we told him of our discoveries regarding the iksar of Freeport, it was he that devised the plan to bring the Swifttail teachings to them.  He personally asked me to make the journey here, and provided me with the means to make my way.

Dominus Rile believes strongly in the strength of all iksar, and our traditions.  He seeks to expand our strength, and to help the people of Freeport who sheltered the lost members of the iksar race when the world shattered.
Remember, once your body and spirit are one, you cannot be broken.  Focus on your inner harmony, and your enemies will fall before you.

npcs.name: Matthias Siegemaker
utterances: Wreak your vengeance upon the helpless, my dear friend.

npcs.name: Matthias Zoe
utterances: I'm glad you have come back for more training, it looks like you've learned quite a bit in a very short time.  I can certify you in your chosen trade class. Before I begin your paperwork I'll need your name.
Best of luck!
I have nothing else to teach you for the moment.  Please return to me when you have earned enough experience to choose your specialty.
I have nothing else to teach you for the moment.  Please return to me when you have earned enough experience to choose your profession.

npcs.name: Mehina
utterances: These stone walls don't keep things out; they keep us in!
There's no place for the elderly in this town.
Ah, to think of all the time I've wasted in this wretched place!
I don't care what they say.  This town is not much to look at, is it?

npcs.name: Melenia Scantus
utterances: I'm not in the mood for chitchat.
Right to the point, eh?  Well, allow me to extend the same courtesy:  you can have my zweihander when you pry it from my dead hands.

npcs.name: Melony Danyells
utterances: Be wary, for some folks around here are only interested in tricks, not treats!

npcs.name: a Menacer Champion
utterances: No one can best the strength of a kerra bruiser!
Move along before my paws dance upon your face.

npcs.name: Metilia Arcavius
utterances: Ah, just the one I've been waiting for.  You've got the port, I trust?  I didn't order a whole case, only a few bottles.
How'd they get opened?  And... they smell a little off.
Well, it's no matter.  My customers won't know the difference anyway.  Have a good one.
Safe travels to you.
The Coalition of Tradesfolke sure knows how to make coins fall into their hands.

npcs.name: Met Sleeth
utterances: Feel free to peruse my fine goods.

Why, no one but the upstanding citizens of Freeport, of course!  I pride myself on honesty and a fair deal.  Anyone who claims otherwise is supporting my competition.  You know how cutthroat business can be, I'm sure.
I can see that you're an honest fellow as well.  You can take me at my word, friend.  The Overlord's will is my own, and I serve Freeport as loyally as a man can.
Well, how about this?  In honor of your hard work and dedication to Freeport, allow me to offer you a complimentary gift.  It's only fair that someone as brave as you is rewarded for your efforts.
Fine.  I see there is no reasoning with you.  Take the damned ledger.  I'm sure you'll find that everything is in order.
Feel free to peruse my...  Oh, it's you again.  What do you want now?
You threatened me and then stole my customer's weapons.  Do you think I'm going to let you sell them back to me?
Draw steel!

npcs.name: Micha Longtail
utterances: Some say that Kerra are  sneaky, evil, and cruel.  True and we have many other fine qualities as well.
Ooh, shiny pointy things.  Just set them down.  I'll see to it that they're distributed properly.
I'd kill to know what the overlord has in that citadel!
The followers of Erud have many debts to pay.

npcs.name: Mikki Denune
utterances: Join in the fights and bring glory to The Ancient Sister, Sullon Zek, Goddess of Rage!

npcs.name: a Militia guard
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.
Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?
The Overlord commands me to work the night shift and so I must accept.
Please do not come near the area while militia officers are conducting their operation.
There is nothing to see here. Move along!
Please leave and take your curiosity elsewhere!
Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!

npcs.name: a Militia officer
utterances: Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!
All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.
Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?

npcs.name: Missionary G`Zule
utterances: You better watch your step if you choose to enter the Temple of War. I would suspect the greeting for a person like yourself would be a dagger in the back rather than a handshake.
It is my station to be here, you worm.  Soon enough I'll take my place inside the temple.
I'll have you know that I have done all the sacrificing I need to do, lucky for your worthless carcass.  I only have to find a symbol of the old paladins to desecrate to fulfill my advancement.

npcs.name: Miyran X'Thall
utterances: I do not have time to speak to you.  My services are only for those who are in powerful guilds who have earned the right to display their colors.

npcs.name: d the Sighted
utterances: Leave Mizzog be.  The spirits do not speak of this one.

npcs.name: Modinite Z'Vol
utterances: Only through intense suffering can one be purified of all weaknesses and frailty.  The Threshing separates the weak willed from the mighty in faith.  Pray that you are not found wanting when your personal Threshing comes...

npcs.name: Mulka the Skinner
utterances: Yeah, that particular one was, uh, bred to have three legs.
This isn't a petting zoo. Either buy something or get lost.
"House trained?" What's that mean?

npcs.name: Myia Selvin
utterances: The spirits call to each of us, but few of us can hear them.

npcs.name: Mykel Miers
utterances: Grab an illusion and join the fun!

npcs.name: Nahirra Usharva
utterances: You must learn to release the chaos and destruction of your power.
The words preached by the Dismal Rage bring spiritual enlightenment to the weak.

npcs.name: Naltar N'Xaana
utterances: Is it possible for an illusionist to get stuck in an illusion?
They say Professor Romiak was slaughtered, however no one mentions anything about his family. I wonder if any of them survived.
I wonder if I'll be allowed to learn a Teir'Dal illusion. Would Queen Cristanos be mad if I do?

npcs.name: Navarius Orvalis
utterances: Search for the relics of the past Age of Turmoil.  Their discovery will gain you great power and prestige!

npcs.name: Nelik Ulnya
utterances: There is a power reawakening.  Some can sense it, and others are oblivious.  However, there are none who will be able to escape it.

npcs.name: Neophyte Jhanov
utterances: All who seek understanding of the Arcane are welcome within the walls of the Academy. Always remember, that above all else, we serve the Overlord!

I knew you were coming.  I had the writ set aside awaiting your imminent return.  This is but a paltry task, but one of vital importance to the Academy.  Return to me once you successfully completed your mission.
Return when you have finished your present task.
I'm afraid I have nothing more to offer you, friend.  Your magical aptitude has surpassed that of my own.  Seek out Archivist Jindlefog inside the Academy.  He can continue teaching you.  Farewell!

npcs.name: Nethal L'tylex
npcs.purpose: Grand Inquisitor of the Dismal Rage
utterances: The Dismal Rage is here to help the people of Freeport understand what it is that they should believe.

npcs.name: Nexa L'Dur
utterances: Achieving achievements is a worthwhile life goal.

npcs.name: a Nights of the Dead celebrator
utterances: Keep an eye out, adventurer!  We wouldn't want you to die of fright.

The Nights of the Dead are here!  The dead you see on this night may not be the victims of his Lordship's justice.  Look around at the decor and illusions that surround you!  Such a frivolous night of beasts and masks have not always been enjoyed.
Too true!  But it is on these nights that instead we enjoy midnight banquets and parades of costumes in observation of the undead assault upon the streets of Maj'Dul.
Relax and enjoy the treats, excitable one, for the attack upon Maj'Dul happened long ago in the early days of the Age of Destiny.

A story that leaves more questions than answers.  'Twas a clear and still night in the desert.  A shambling army of undead inundated the city of Maj'Dul.  The city hid themselves from the walking dead, for fear of what this force was there to do.  Kill?  Kidnap?  Desecrate?  Feed?  And those that did not huddle in fear battled the innumerable undead to defend their city.

Quite different!  The citizens soon took notice that the decaying bodies were not harming anyone, except for those that stood in their way.  The ghastly figures would break down doors, and rummage through all of a person's possessions, smashing anything open that was otherwise latched or sealed.

This was to last a week, when as mysteriously as they came, they departed.  They turned in mid action, and shuffled back to the sands from which they came, as if answering a ghoulish cry.  The people of Maj'Dul never learned what it was that the undead were looking for, nor what they finally found.  But we commemorate that week of monsters and frights in search of goodies in old Maj'Dul with our own week of beasts and treats.
Enjoy the festivities of The Nights of the Dead.  You know you want to!

npcs.name: Nipius Malchus
utterances: Hail to you as well.  Forgive me if we've met before...  I'm a little distracted.  I've more custom orders for armor then I've the tradesmen to match.

npcs.name: Occultist Levonicus
utterances: Please do not interrupt my meditations, fool!  I need absolute silence to ponder this important matter.

The Temple is grateful for your service, but we now see you have a higher calling in our order.  You must seek out Blight Sage Destroz from within these walls.  His knowledge of the unknown will aid you in your spiritual journey to purge the land of this heretical wave!  Safe travels, my young initiate!

npcs.name: Odyssneu
utterances: What can I help you acquire today?
Welcome, friend! The wares of an entire city are at your fingertips. So please make your selection.

npcs.name: Othmir Tradeskill Apprentice
utterances: Hello there!  I notice an air of mastery around you.  Are you an experienced tradesman?
My brethren and I have traveled to this temperate land in search of master craftsmen like you.  With our combined effort, we can craft truly astounding items!
You give me a roof over my head and access to your knowledge.  I will do all of the researching legwork, and once research is complete, I will share the recipe with you.  What do you say?

Of course, of course!  Give me a second to write out the details...that should do it!  Here you go!  Take this and place it in your house.  I will arrive and start research once the contract has been placed.Also, take this Mannequin.  You cannot choose the uniform I wear, but the mannequin may prove useful if you have my colleagues working for you in the future.

npcs.name: a pacified Freeport dweller
utterances: Let the weak Qeynosians rot.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
Luclin shines so bright...
We must not doubt our Overlord. We owe much to his leadership!
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Freeport still stands.
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, the Overlord would save us.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
See! We never needed Qeynos' help! The Overlord can do it all on his own!
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
We owe the Overlord a great deal.
Those who wish Freeport to fall are fools! Let Bertox take them.
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.

npcs.name: Painter Brushwuttle
utterances: Oh, you're here with the wine?  Thanks.  Just set it down and I'll get to it later.
Aren't we the fancy pants?  Well, port wine then.  I don't know what it's called.  I just know that I like it.  Hatchet has that, how do you say... flavor.
Hey, thanks for delivering that wine.  I can't get enough of it!

npcs.name: Paragon Jalex
utterances: Your lesson is nearly complete.  I'm afraid I've nothing more to offer you and your companions.  You will need the wisdom of Thaumaturge Ranollious, and through his guidance, you will reach your full potential.  Goodbye, my faithful student.
I don't know who permitted you inside, but it's considered rude for a whelp to interfere with the studies of a Paragon such as me.  Please remove yourself from my sight!

npcs.name: a party crashing orc
utterances: I'll bash your head in!
We will not stop until we spoil your celebrations.
You can't have those decorations back.
Back off!

npcs.name: Pazuzu
utterances: Grrrr!  Arrgh!
Better watch yourself during these festivities.  We wouldn't want something bad happening to you!

npcs.name: a perceived conspirator
utterances: Straying a bit, are we?
Watch yerself, this city can be rough.
Hah! New around these parts?

npcs.name: Phrau Blucher
utterances: Happy Nights of the Dead!
Be wary, for some folks around here are only interested in tricks, not treats!

npcs.name: Pinchy Presentpeeler
utterances: Golly, I'm so glad you showed up, <player name>. Hopefully, you can save our leader and our home. We are starting to get real sad.

We need you because our leader, Lord Bowsprite, has disappeared and our home has been taken over! We have no idea what to do without his strong leadership. He is the most honorable, noblest of elves. He takes care of all of us, tells us what to do when we are sad, or confused and he makes us laugh. He is the bestest leader, ever! With the meanie pants green fella living in our home and Lord Bowsprite missing we have no clue what to do!

We know for sure it was those mean goblins, but we don't know where they took him or why. The greenie goblin that took over our home just showed up the other day. We tried to hug him, but he got really cross and yelled at us. Then our home suddenly became downright freezing and there are all these strange monsters roaming around. We all got very, very scared. We think maybe that mean old goblin brought them. We need Lord Bowsprite to tell us what to do.

We don't know. There are so many tribes of them, the Fubbyfuzzers, the Hammyhousers, the Runnyeyes, the Snickysniffers, the Pickclaws, the Gigglegibbers, the Swammyswimmers... I just don't know. The only clue I have is the greenie that has taken over our land kept talking about making gold and strange schemes. He wasn't very smart neither.

Let me think... He said something like, "Spinning numbers, spin real fast, they lose lots of moneys and then they gasp. Gold, silver, platinum please, if you win then we sneeze." We thought it was the silliest song. It made us all laugh real hard, so we started singing it with him and dancing around, but I think it made him madder. Greenie gobbys are so weird.
Hurry quick and let us know when you find our beloved Lord Bowsprite.

npcs.name: Polycethes
utterances: In spite of the cost of living, it's still quite a popular item.

npcs.name: Preceptor Rhaskos
utterances: Bloody rangers! Their kind 'ave no business 'ere.
Bloody right I am! I 'ear they 'ave eyes 'an ears everywhere! Gods 'elp ya should they 'ear ya speak an ill word 'bout the Overlord.

Aye, though not directly. Rumor 'as it that their leader, some bloke named Jackal, came 'ere lookin' to settle a score wit one o' dem nasty Bloodskull orcs. Seems he an 'is mates were causin' a bit of a ruckus out there in the Commonlands, attackin' travelers, orcish or otherwise.

Well, with all the madness 'appening 'round 'ere after the Overlord's disappearance, the Militia and the Lucanic Knights 'ad their hands full. The Commonlands quickly became a very dangerous place.  Once ol' one-eye returned, however, he wasted little time before sendin' out 'is Knights to apprehend the criminals.

The Lucanic Knights did eventually track down Jackal and 'is merry band o' thieves. I don' know what 'appened when they met, but it's obvious the Overlord 'as come to some sorta agreement wit these Red Hoods. Now the same bloody lot who once robbed us is walkin' about plain as day through our city.

I even seen some 'o them train'n Militia members to become archers. Bloody wonderful that is! Only in Freeport can you be shot in the bloody 'ead by some greenhorn ranger as you walk to the bloody farmer's market.
Aye. Life in Freeport is a fickle existence. Wear a bloody 'elmet.

npcs.name: a prisoner escort
utterances: Prisoner, on your knees!
The Overlord, Lucan D'Lere, is now in court!

npcs.name: Privateer Twitchwhisker
utterances: Have you come to join the Seafury Buccaneers?  Open seas and plenty of swag await you!

npcs.name: Profallia
utterances: Wait a minute, please forgive me.  What was it you were looking for again?
Hello there, friend.  I believe we have that new medicine in stock that you were asking about.  That was you, wasn't it?
Please don't hurt me! You can have whatever! Wait a minute, you're not here to rob me?

npcs.name: Professor Flimflam
utterances: Ah, to be young again... and also a clockwork.
Yes, there's no safer occupation than tinkering.
They'll regret their actions when they see my fully functional necro-clockwork!

npcs.name: Progenitus
utterances: Hello! Can I offer you one of our new lifetime extended warranties for any merchandise you purchase?
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.

npcs.name: Qalantir
utterances: Good day! How can I help you, my friend? Do you stand before me in search of knowledge?

npcs.name: Quartermaster Redplate
utterances: What can I do for you?
What type of mold do you have?

npcs.name: Raga
utterances: I use fear to kill my enemies.
I can hear breaking bones from many hills away.
In the heat of battle is the only way to die.

npcs.name: Rake
utterances: If the Overlord hadn't returned, trade through the Commonlands would have been completely controlled by the Red Hoods.

npcs.name: Ranik Calman
utterances: Aye. Welcome to the Seafarer's Roost. Been out at sea for a while, or just stopping through? Put some coin in my hand and I'll sell ye drinks until ye sail out again.

npcs.name: Ratscallion Attamilgad
utterances: Cloakses! Get your cloakses, here!

npcs.name: R'dyles Mar'dril
utterances: Be on your way.  I have research to conduct.

npcs.name: a relieved Freeport dweller
utterances: Luclin shines so bright...
Let the weak Qeynosians rot.
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
We must not doubt our Overlord. We owe much to his leadership!
See! We never needed Qeynos' help! The Overlord can do it all on his own!
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Freeport still stands.
Those who wish Freeport to fall are fools! Let Bertox take them.
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, the Overlord would save us.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
We owe the Overlord a great deal.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.

npcs.name: Renny Parvat
utterances: What are you looking at? Stay away from me, and keep your hands off my collections, you scumbag!
This is a decent find, I suppose. I can give you a small reward for it.

What collections?  What do you mean, "What collections?" My collections, you fool! If you think you're going to get them from me, you're wrong!   But if you have something to donate, then maybe we can talk.

npcs.name: Rhahrda Olhymne
utterances: Greetings!

npcs.name: Riss Taskel
utterances: In time, all conflicts are resolved.

npcs.name: Roslyn Mischeva
utterances: What ho! Hail, my dear adventurer, my wonderful hero. You stand before Roslyn Mischeva, leader of this band of dirty misfits and talented raconteurs! May I say, you are in luck to have run into us at this fortuitous time!

Why is that? Well, it is none other than the Heroes' Festival, my good friend! And the Mischeva Play-Actors have been employed by the good people of Norrath to put together a show that properly celebrates the triumphs that the great heroes of this world have accomplished!

Yes, really! And the best part? The best part is YOU get to play the hero! The Mischeva Play-Actors will play the part of the nefarious antagonist! Will you help us? Will you swoop in to save the day from these terrible creatures?!

Just come as you are! You can find us nearly anywhere in Norrath, but we can't tell you when! That would spoil the surprise! Just stick to those places that you can handle, and we'll show up eventually!
Fantastic! We'll see you soon, <player name>!
Come, join us, <player name>! You are a hero, are you not?

npcs.name: a Roughhouser Champion
utterances: Take a gander, please. It is not often one encounters the perfect killing machine.

npcs.name: Rumdum
utterances: Keep the ale comin'!  I haven't lost my balance...
What in Zek do you want?  Can't ya see I'm drinkin' here...
Are ya callin' me smelly?!  Nobody calls Rumdum Clurg smelly!
Yeah, a drink.  That sounds good.  I need a drink... this one's almost empty.
Oooo!  The good stuff!  You're a good kid ... yeah, a good kid.  This stein has a crack in it!  I'm gettin' ale everywhere!
Let me tell ya somethin'... They just don't make steins like they used to ... My great great greatest grandpappy had a stein.  It was a magical!

Oooo yeah... it held the best drinks ... Ogre swill ... Flaming Clurg ... Oh!  Flaming Clurg!  Now there's a drink! Burns yer belly and freezes yer eyeballs... I remember my first Flaming Clurg... I was five years old and--

Mmmmm ale... Oh yeah, the magic stein.  It was called the Stein of Mophawk ... err ... Mogpok ... err ... Moggok!  That's it! The Stein of Moggok! Too bad that stein is gone now...  It was supposed to make you smarter or somethin'.
Froglok?!  Let me tell ya somethin' 'bout them Frogloks... them froggies are only good fer squishin'.  I remember the first time I squished a Froglok ... I was five-years old and --

Mmmmm ale ...  Where was I?  Oh yeah ... the stein. If it weren't for those dumb Bouncers fightin' over whose turn it was to use it for drinkin', it might still be around.  Now it's all in pieces... What you gonna do with pieces of a stein?  Ya can't put no ale in it ... It would just fall out on the floor...
Duh! The Bouncers have 'em.  They was the stubborn type, ya know... each keepin' a piece so no one could fix the thing.  They even carried the pieces with them when they went back on duty.

Militia?!  Let me tell you somethin' about the Freeport Militia... I didn't need them; they needed me... Okay?  Just cuz I came to work with a lil' ale on my breath one, two, three .... okay, ten times... they kick me out!  I been smashing froggies since I was five-years old and --
Mmmmm ale... Where was I?

I suppose they is still in the Feerrott doin' their duty. Or they're dead. It's been a really long time... They's probably dead, but ya never know these days. People just don't want to stay dead... Let me tell ya something about the undead...

npcs.name: Salonia Siculus
utterances: No beggars and no solicitors.  If you don't have business to conduct then stand aside!
Welcome to the Freeport Reserve.  State your business.
Ouch, that's your balance?
No, the furniture isn't for sale.  Did you have business with the bank?

npcs.name: Salonina Herminia
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Santa Glug's Curious Clerk
utterances: I love counting my chocolate coins!
I'm coo-coo for chocolate coins!

npcs.name: Sanura Lithestripe
utterances: Oh?  What's this?

Ah, yes.  I'd been told to expect you.  I understand you're bringing weapons that need to be refurbished and stamped with the seal of the city.  Let's see what you've got.  Hmm... Some of these are in fine shape, barely used at all.  And... wait a second.  Where did you say these came from?
Hsss... I should have known.  If the blood of the Buccaneers was shed in order to obtain these blades, then I'm not happy about it.  But more importantly, the Buccaneers won't be happy about it.

This animosity directed at the Buccaneers is completely unfounded.  And if you ask me, the Militia isn't any nobler.  At least the Buccaneers don't lord their authority over the rest of us, like my husband--gods bless him for being a pigheaded fascist.
I know it's rude to discuss city politics with a stranger.  Forgive me, <player name>.  It just gets me so agitated.
We've jabbered enough.  I'll get to work on these right away. Unity in Lucan.
I'm very busy, so please don't disturb me unless you need something specific.

npcs.name: Saveth Noolright
utterances: Here's one for Sir Lucan: 'He's just a ruler. In a long line of rulers. Looking for a few more orcs to slay. They say that he fights them with one hand tied to his back. And he won't leave Freeport till you remember his name.'

npcs.name: Scientist Dally Scrumplecog
utterances: The Freeport Militia is only as competent as their ability to swing a longsword.
The members within the Coalition of Tradefolke are nothing more than common thieves that empty your pockets before your eyes.

npcs.name: Scout of Discord
utterances: I am here to sow the seeds of discord. Chaos and death!

npcs.name: Scythe
utterances: The Green Hoods of Qeynos lack the will needed to get things done.
Being on the Overlord's payroll is a lot easier than ambushing caravans.

npcs.name: a Seafury corsair
utterances: Treat us badly in Neriak! I laugh now we in same spot!
Tasty treats, lots of meats.
Nasty scars and boiled tar!  Warriors is what we are!
You thought you were so superior, and look who you come to for protection when things get rough.
Straying a bit, are we?
It's a fine day for evil to flourish!
Watch yerself, this city can be rough.
What a foul, dirty place this is compared to Neriak.
Ohh, they'll never suspect that, no they won't!
Perhaps the dark ones will require our services in the future.
Yes, yes, that will do nicely... err, hello, who are you?
Yes, yes, hello. I'm busy.
Smart or not, you're in Freeport now.
Oh, drat, I hope not. Oh, sorry, I thought you might have meant the weather.
I use fear to kill my enemies.
Too much coin to hire one like you, I'd wager.
Hah! New around these parts?
A good rat is a dead rat.  Good thing you're not really a rat, eh?

npcs.name: Seafury Felvonitor
utterances: The Seafury Buccaneers dominate the high seas. There is no competition, matey.
I don't trust the Freeport Militia. Neither should you, mate.
The Dismal Rage is hideous I tell you. I always get the shivers when I pass by them.

npcs.name: Seafury Skysearch
utterances: The Seafury Buccaneers are feared by all others on the open sea. They show no mercy to the dogs that try to sail the sea unprotected.
You might as well hand your loot to the Coalition of Tradesfolke if you ever decide to work for them.
I'd rather be stranded overboard than be converted by the dark beliefs that Dismal Rage preaches.

npcs.name: Selyse Brazenroot
utterances: Glory to The Overlord.

npcs.name: Sergeant Daimyo
utterances: This is the slowest armorer this side of Freeport.

npcs.name: Sergeant Nominus
utterances: Hail, citizen.  If you have something to report, then speak up.  Otherwise, move along.
Hmmm... perhaps you can help me.  I'm trying to track down a rogue who's preying upon the fisherman and clergy folk here in the City of Freeport.  His name is Pythus.

Several of my guards have been ordered to other parts of the city.  Since my requests for reinforcements have gone ignored, I don't have the men to track down the rogue. But at the same time, they tell me I have to find this Pythus or else.  I don't know how much longer I can put up with this!
I need you to follow our leads and track down Pythus.  Once you find him, make sure he never works again.  You bring me Pythus' cap, and I'll pay you for the effort.  Deal?

npcs.name: Sergeant Typhoeus
utterances: It's hard to impress the Overlord. Trust me, I know.

npcs.name: Serris
utterances: Shhh, <player name>.  Don't draw any undue attention to uss.  Did you ssee to it that the weaponss made it to Sanura?
Sspare me no truthss.  Had Sanura heard any rumorss of your infiltration?  Did she know about the sslain Buccaneerss?
Sso what else did Ssanura ssay?
What iss the attraction women have for thievess?  Have they no resspect for order, no sensse of sself-worth, no undersstanding of danger?
It sskins my sscales to have our hard work sspat upon by ssomeone whose political viewss were learned from songss of romance.  Should we ssurvive thiss, I wish to have wordss with Sanura.

Because thiss could not have gone more poorly.  Though I trusst Sanura not to get involved, the drunkardss that esscaped will doubtlessly inform Bloodbeak of our activitiess.  We musst act ssilenty and sswiftly, <player name>!

There iss only one thing we can do:  eliminate the drunkardss who ssaw you, before word getss back to the rest of the Buccaneerss.  For the good of our own skinss and the ssanctity of the city, we musst prevent the conflict that will ensue if they discover that representativess of the Militia killed their men.  Meet me at the Sseafury Ssafehouse.
Sstop right there, citizen!  I would have wordss with you.

Not to worry, citizen.  This iss an opportunity to sserve the city and one that only a fool would passs up.  There are benefitss to working with the Militia.  You would be on the right sside of the law and at the right hand of Lucan.

The city guard hass cracked down on weapon ssaless to unqualified citizens, but this hasn't stopped the illegal transsfer of blades in our city.  The lasst thing Freeport needss iss another bloody civil war.  Through some... perssuasion, I've uncovered the names of vendors who have been sselling to those who are not authorized to carry armss.

I can't confront all of the vendors at once.  As ssoon as the firsst one is aware of our questioning, the rest will amend their bookss or make themselvess sscarce.  We're going to need to ssplit up.  I'll speak to Ikthar Icehammer and my old friend Skaznik, while you sspeak to Sleeth and Jan MacGetz.  Get their ledgerss to find out who they've been sselling to.  And <player name>... expect a fight.
Sso, did you get their ledgerss?

Make no misstake, <player name>.  The sstability of the city dependss on our vigilance.  There are no neutral partiess in Freeport, only those that ssupport it, and those who would do it harm.  It iss the duty of the faithful, you and I, to eliminate the latter.  Now, let'ss ssee those ledgerss.

Yess, yess, yess.  As I expected, arms were being sold to the Commonlands Dervishes.  But even worse, there are citizenss who have weaponry without city approval.  We musst confisscate their armss immediately.  Can I count on you again, <player name>?

Ssplendid.  First, get the shipmentss of armss that have made their way to the dervishess in the Commonlandss.  Second, find the dissidentss on thiss lisst, and collect their weaponss.  In both cases, expect a fight!
Sso, did you disarm the citizenss?

I'm glad you did not ssuccumb to their whimpering or back down from a fight.  It iss important to take a hard line againsst these citizenss.  Mysself, I wass forced to sslay many men who refused to relinquish their blades.
Of coursse, <player name>.  You are wise beyond your yearss.

Yes.  Now that we've sseen to the recipients of these weapons, we can look into where they're coming from.  I've scoured the ledgers, and have found damning proof to confirm what I had already suspected: the purchase orders are signed with the profile of a hawk's head, stamped in red.  Do you ssee what thiss meanss?

It remains to be sseen if the Coalition is involved in this underground market.  Perhapss they are, and perhapss they aren't.  To be honest, neither answer would ssurprise me.  But, no - they aren't the supplierss.

The red sstamp of the hawk's head next to the purchase orderss iss the ssymbol for Bloodbeak, the leader of the Seafury Buccaneerss.  Sso it iss up to uss to sstop them, and sstaunch the unregulated flow of weaponss into the handss of our enemiess.  Of course, there are complicationss...

The politicss of Freeport are delicate and complicated.  The Lucanic Knightss will not get involved in this matter, and for good reason - tangling with the Buccaneers hass the potential to spark a bloody conflict.  The fewer that know of your actionss, the better.  You musst be as ssilent and sswift as a shadow.
You must find the source of these armss.  To sstart, go now to the sseaside dockss.  If that fails, sscour the city.  Time iss of the essence.  Can I count on you again, <player name>?
Come ssee me when you've matured a bit, sscrappling.

npcs.name: Shaun Rom'zomcom
utterances: Grrrr!  Arrgh!

npcs.name: Shirzzt Bonelasher
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.

npcs.name: Shivna Crane
utterances: Man do I love gnome bread!  The trolls, they just love gnomes period!
Hey do you see any water around here?  Oh well, who needs to wash their hands?

npcs.name: Shrew
utterances: Careful where you tread, adventurer. You're stepping on official Red Hood training grounds. It'd be shame if a recruit's stray arrow were to embed itself in that shiny forehead of yours.

Mind your tongue, fool! The Green Hoods are nothing more than a bunch of butterfly chasin' nature-lovers. The mere sight of a broken twig causes 'em to break down in tears. The Red Hoods suffer no such weakness.

Such a word has many meanings, does it not? It is true that we track our prey with little effort. Bird and beast tell us where our enemies maneuver. No weapon exists which we cannot wield with deadly efficiency. We are the crimson serpent that lay waiting in the grass for our next victim. Consider yourself lucky that the Jackal has no use for your hide.

Why doesn't it surprise me that you've never heard of our revered leader? Hmm, where to begin? The Jackal was once a member of the Green Hoods before he became fed up with their weak-handed approach in dealing with orcs of Deathfist Citadel. Others viewed his methods as unsound or too brutal. Hmph!  Brutally efficient if you ask me.
Why? Are you a spy? Who hired you? Did Ralem send you?
Very well, if you really do wish to learn more about our kind, keep your lips sealed and I will tell you the real story of Jackal.
Good. Now, listen up. I don't have time to repeat myself. The real reason Jackal left the Green Hoods was because they failed him when he needed them most.

A few years ago, while Jackal was away reconnoitering troop movement outside Deathfist Citadel, a band of orcs stumbled upon one of the Green Hood villages.  While the guards easily slew most of the intruders, one orc managed to evade detection by ducking into one of the village cabins.

Inside, the orc discovered a sleeping Feir'Dal who went by the alias, Thistle. As the orc approached her bed, she awoke and screamed in horror. Just as the wanton beast was about to bear down upon her, several Green Hoods burst into the room and found the orc holding a blade to the frightened wood elf's throat.

In haste, the rangers fired their arrows into the fiend's back. The orc howled in pain and rose swiftly, placing Thistle between himself and the rangers. In a crude form of Common he barked for them to stand down lest he slit the elf's neck.

The men reluctantly lowered their bows, allowing the attacker to exit the cabin and escape into the night with the girl thrown over his shoulder. Later, when Jackal returned from his mission, he learned of the attack on the village and the abduction of Thistle.

You see, Thistle was not only a member of the Green Hoods, but also Jackal's betrothed. When he insisted on going after the kidnapper he was met with protest from his commanding officers. There was no hope in finding her alive, they insisted. If anything, Thistle would be used as bait to lure the Green Hoods out of the forest and into a trap set by the Deathfist orcs.

Jackal grew furious with his peers and accused them of cowardice. When his friends failed to take his side, Jackal quit the Green Hoods on the spot and went off looking for the orc who had taken his lover.

Not before she was killed, unfortunately. Jackal found Thistle's frail body, beaten and smashed, in a clearing not far from the village. Though he would never admit it to us, I'm certain the pain he felt after losing her was immeasurable.

Jackal made finding the murderer his singular focus. For months he stalked the orcs of Deathfist, slaying scores of their kind before he finally tracked down one who knew the identity of the village attacker.

He learned that the orc, named Kogrish Nailripper, had a reputation for unpredictable cruelty and had recently killed one of Emperor Fyst's advisors. Rather than sentencing him to his death, the emperor decided to instead banish Kogrish to the Commonlands of D'Lere.

The Deathfist Empire often exile their criminals and deserters to a newly organized horde known as the Bloodskulls. These orcs wage war against Freeport in hopes of performing some great act which gain them favor with those who cast them out.

Correct. Along his travels, however, he met several who had heard of his tale and wished to join him on his quest for revenge. He named his followers the Red Hoods and taught us the skills he had once learned from his former order.
Now we defend the innocent travelers who make the arduous journey across D'Lere, ever vigilant for signs of Kogrish Nailripper.

Our business here is our own. Suffice to say, the Overlord is sympathetic to our cause and has offered to assist us in our quest. In exchange for his knowledge, Jackal has agreed to garrison several of us here to help defend Freeport's battlements with our bows. Additionally, we've agreed to teach those who we deem worthy the arts of a ranger.

npcs.name: Sicangu Wi
utterances: Good day, <player name>.  What brings you here this fine day?

npcs.name: Sidonius Baro
utterances: Let me guess, you're looking for poison right?
Be careful what you touch in here.  You're liable to kill us all!

npcs.name: a Silly Billy Talent Scout
utterances: You want to honor the Great Prankster, don't you?

Have I an opportunity for you! I represent the Silly Billy Sticky Fingers. We're a tight group of like-minded halflings and other followers of Bristlebane, looking to honor the King of Thieves and lift his name through action!

I won't hold that against you. I've taken out my fair share, too. Oh, but if you're concerned about getting your hands dirty, as it were, I've got a solution for you; Send in your agents to do the job.

A heist competition! We, the Silly Billy Sticky Fingers, were challenged by the G. Williker Burglars, to steal the Lyre of Prayer, a minstrel's sacrosanct instrument held in a private collection, and deliver it to the Plane of Mischief.
Oh, yes! Of course the real winner will be the Great Prankster, either way, but you know... we want to prove ourselves superior thieves. Are you in?

npcs.name: Skaznik
utterances: In spite of the cost of living, it's still quite a popular item.
Are you going to buy anything today, or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
Hello! Can I offer you one of our new lifetime extended warranties for any merchandise you purchase?
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Skrig
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Slaughtergrott the Vigilant
utterances: Exciting journeys at sea!  See the new world!
You're of no use to me. You're incapable of finding what I need.
You want to explore?  Rediscover lost lands?
I need someone adept in adventuring.  Are you the one?  Are you willing to aid in the discovery of a land lost since the Shattering?
You're interested. That's good. What we discuss from here out is secret and not to be discussed with outsiders.  Is this understood?
You're about to help me find the Feerrott.  This is no small effort, and you may need to gather a small group of adventurers to aid you.

Long ago, the orcs at Zek allied themselves with the Rallosian army.  The orcs are still in possession of much of the Rallosian army's equipment that was left when their empire fell.  The maps or writings leading to the location of the Feerrott must be amongst them. Go to the Orcish Wastes and find this information. Got it?
Adventure!  You want it!  I tell you where to get it!

npcs.name: Slinko
utterances: We weren't expecting a visitor.  Are you lost?
What?  How will we protect ourselves?  How will we protect our family?

Hmm, maybe you're new in town.  In our experience, half the time the Militia is what we need protection from.  The rest of the time, they show up after any fighting's already over.  In either case, we'd rather be armed than defenseless.
Don't suppose we have much choice in the matter, do we?  Here, take them.  We hope you're right about us being safe here.
We hope you're right about us being safe here.

npcs.name: Slinks Hardtoes
utterances: Hey theres. Are yous enjoying the festivities? If so, helps mes with something, wills ya?
Those cursed orcs went sneaky into the city through the sewer systems and have been stealings the decorations I put ups.
I needs yous to gets those decorations backs and put them back ups. I'm too busy and importants to do it myselfs.
Yous better gets the decorations back. If the festival is ruines, I'm blaming yous.
I sees more decorations than befores. Did yous finish?
Wells, that's surprisings. Heres is yous reward as promises. Nows go enjoys the festival, whiles yous still cans.

npcs.name: S'mara Mooregan
utterances: I'm not celebrating Nights of the Dead.  This is what I always wear!

npcs.name: Sneel Valiyn
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Soldier of Discord
utterances: I am here to sow the seeds of discord. Chaos and death!

npcs.name: Soleficus Baro
utterances: What services are you interested in, citizen?
Ouch, that's your balance?
This is the Freeport Reserve.  What's your business?
No beggars and no solicitors.  If you don't have business to conduct then stand aside!

npcs.name: Speculator Montanlooa
utterances: Uncork one of those bottles, if you would.
Err, this tastes like... like... ogre swill.  You're trying to sell me ogre swill!
I'll melt your flesh!
Fine!  You win, this time.  Just leave the shipment here.
Hey, you tried to sell me ogre swill!  Get lost!

npcs.name: Squab Kalina
utterances: Well done, friend!  I'd let you watch my back at sea any day.  You've more than proven yourself to the crew.  I have nothing more that would challenge an adventurer of your caliber.

Ha! The life of a free trader is not all fun and games, you know!  We Seafury Buccaneers have a responsibility to guard the waterways in the name of the Overlord!  It's a responsibility we take seriously.

npcs.name: Stamper Jeralf
utterances: Indeed, <player name> what might I do for you?
Ah, I struck out from my clan in Temple Street when the gnomes started their undisciplined tinkering.
Oh no, it's not like that at all!  On the contrary, their actions with Necromecanica and with the despoiling arts pleases Lord Bertoxxulous.
Indeed, the very one! The Gnomes' work with death energies can indeed be enhanced, whether they desire it or not. Bless the plague if I can assist in any way!

npcs.name: Steven
utterances: What's up? What's up? What's up?
