npcs.name: Steward Kres
utterances: Ah, adventurer, hello! I am pleased that I can get a bit of your time.
Allow me to introduce myself. I am Steward Kres, a member of the Conservatory. We are a group involved in some fascinating research, some of which might even be beneficial to you as an adventurer.

I'm glad that you asked! Our group had access to a fantastic Menagerie up in Everfrost. There, we were able to collect the most remarkable creatures, and have spent months cataloging and attempting to understand them and the nature of familiar bonding.

The same! Miragul's notes on the subject were fascinating, and we actually made some impressive discoveries, if I do say so myself. The nature of familiar bonding is far deeper than I believe anyone understood, and is no longer restricted to the arcane arts.
As much as it pains me to say it, there was an accident. Our keep, the home of the Conservatory, was badly damaged and the creatures under our care escaped, far out of our reach.

Indeed, but not to return to us. As I said, the Conservatory grounds are badly damaged, and it could be some time before they are rebuilt. No, we're asking that if you find them, bond with them yourself - it would be the most favorable outcome given all that has happened.

Correct. The Conservatory cannot complete its tasks, and it is better that the familiars and in the company of adventurers. Here, please take this tome - it will explain who we are, how we came to be, and give you a list of most of the familiars that have gone missing. Perhaps you will find it useful.
Hello <player name>! I have a small task for you if you are interested.
We are seeking more creatures that could further our studies.  If you are willing, we need you to take these empty cages and capture some more familiar specimens for us.
Fantastic news, more specimens that will be a huge help in our research!

npcs.name: Surabaya
utterances: It's about time you got here.  Let's have a look at the goods, shall we?
What's this?  Most of the bottles have already been opened, and poorly resealed.  Are you trying to pull one over on me, courier?
I'll plant a blade in your innards, I will!  No one cheats Surabaya.
I yield, I yield!  Just leave the bottles and leave me alone.
No one cheats Surabaya!
Sharp teeth, the better to tear flesh with.
Make war not love.
Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.

npcs.name: Susan Stout
utterances: I wonder if we should start performing without him?

npcs.name: a suspected renegade
utterances: You thought you were so superior, and look who you come to for protection when things get rough.
Oh, drat, I hope not. Oh, sorry, I thought you might have meant the weather.
Armor is just an extension of my skin.
Drinking the blood of your enemy only makes you stronger.
I can hear breaking bones from many hills away.

npcs.name: Swynend Sithtenias
utterances: What on Norrath am I going to do?
I am the manager of the minstrel band that is supposed to be putting on a show for the Heroes' Festival right now! But one of my band members is nowhere to be found.

His name is Gimit Delerg, and I would bet that fool is somewhere with his big nose in a mug of ale. I took a look around, but couldn't find him. I've lost all patience, perhaps you should find him or else I might not let him live to play.
I'm sure he is in a bar somewhere around Freeport. You better find him.
Well, I am surprised, the band is up and playing again. What happened?
He is still a little off tempo and wobbly, but I suppose this will have to do. You didn't do too badly, <player name>. Perhaps I can get you to do a little more for us.

Attendance is low, and so is the money coming in. We need to hand out more fliers advertising all the 'festivities', but they should be handed out with accuracy. What we need is the attendance of more heroes, since this is a Heroes' Festival.
You need to locate promising looking individuals and give them these fliers. But a hero won't just take a flier, you must catch their attention by shoving it right into their face!
Don't question me, fool! You have to be aggressive when it comes to heroes. Will you do it or not?
Were you successful in identifying promising heroes?
Good. Now we just wait for those 'walking purses' to start trickling in.

npcs.name: Tall Jim
utterances: Make us all happier, and mind your own business.

npcs.name: Tarakh
utterances: Keep your tongue to yourself, lest you find it missing.
Is that so?  And what, pray tell, do you think you have that is of any value to me?
I'll toss you a few coins if you give me the note.  Deal?
Hey!  This doesn't tell me where to find the meeting place or crypt!

npcs.name: Thaumaturge Frostheart
utterances: Watch yerself, this city can be rough.
Hah! New around these parts?

npcs.name: Thaumaturge G'Lex
utterances: One day, our lot will improve here.
It's a fine day for evil to flourish!

npcs.name: Thaumaturge K'Thiz
utterances: The Coalition of Tradesfolke aren't capable of serving anyone other than to serve its own greed.
I find it vile that our great city has entrusted its protection to a group of degenerates such as the Freeport Militia.

npcs.name: Thaumaturge Pulo
utterances: The Seafury Buccaneers are a corrupted bunch that can not be trusted to do anything.

npcs.name: Thaumaturge Ranollious
utterances: I see a slew of possibilities within you.  You have the look of an adventurer. Such courage is uncommon, but Freeport still doubts your fortitude.

npcs.name: Thaumaturge Sadiiz
utterances: Oh, drat, I hope not. Oh, sorry, I thought you might have meant the weather.
Yes, yes, hello. I'm busy.

npcs.name: Thaumaturge T'bor
utterances: One day, our lot will improve here.

npcs.name: Thavian Destrus
utterances: Hail.

npcs.name: Thesla Blackthorne
utterances: Do you have business with me?

npcs.name: Tohsa B'hondus
utterances: Do not disturb my studies, whelp.

npcs.name: Tome Warden K'Narn
utterances: Busy! Very busy! Books, tomes, scrolls and lexicons ... the knowledge never ends nor does my work.
Ah! One of the field guides of the Hasten Bootstrutter! This shall make a fine addition to our library. The Academy of Arcane Science thanks you for your contribution.

My task you ask? Look about! Walls and walls of knowledge ... many once lost and newly recovered by agents of the Academy. I am the Tome Warden. I must organize! Place this book here and that book there! It never ends! I am also the first to touch the lost tomes and the one to reward any offering of lost knowledge.

npcs.name: Torbett Witlocke
utterances: Don't let your illusions be shattered!

npcs.name: Torlig the Alchemist
utterances: Shhhh! Don't distract me ... I need a steady hand to ensure I combine this potion correctly. One mistake and the blast will reduce this building to rubble. Deal with my apprentices if you want to buy something.

npcs.name: T'ral D'zarn
utterances: Don't bother me!  I'm waiting to speak to someone, and I don't have time to deal with you!

npcs.name: Trooper Bonesaw
utterances: I don't say this often, but it seems my liege was wrong about your band of cutthroats.  You've been useful to the city, and have earned a measure of respect in Freeport.  You need to report to Liege Helvanica immediately. She's waiting for you in the Militia House!
Death to those who betray the Overlord! Only the bravest and the strongest organizations can stand with Freeport and the Militia!

npcs.name: Trtsin
utterances: Greetings, <player name>.  What brings you to the docks today?

npcs.name: Tullia Domna
utterances: Come hither... how can I, Queen Antonia Bayle, serve you?

npcs.name: Tullia Sulla
utterances: Welcome to the Academy of Arcane Science.  If you are one of the gifted few that has begun their studies into the mysteries of the arcane, the wonders of pure magic, the marvels of...  But I digress.  If you are one of these select few, then I have materials that are of great interest to you.

npcs.name: Tyluna Whittlebit
utterances: Howdy, back at you.
Never gonna give up on true love, eh?  Hehehe.  Well, I don't blame ya, but what makes you think you're my type?
My, that was embarrassing!  Well, I love my kitties.  Oh, and I craft little figurines... mostly of kitties, mind you!
And all of nature, really.  I enjoy listening to birds sing, walking in dew damp grass, watching the tide come in –Nature in its entire splendor!

npcs.name: Tyrael Emsworth
utterances: Move along now. You've got places to be and this ain't it.
What are you gawking at? Far Seas Traders just drop you off or something?
You're kidding!? I didn't think those salty dogs were still ferrying folk around! Huh... Bit of advice, this city doesn't take well to layabouts or drunkards begging for scraps.
I'm just saying, find yourself a job, lest you be inducted into one of The Overlord's work crews. This city doesn't clean itself. You get me?
Listen here, you can't just go anywhere in Freeport asking for work though. Tell you what, I know someone you should speak with. They'll help you get your bearings.
They are. Name's Derald Walldons. You'll find 'em in South Freeport.

npcs.name: Ulhira Grissh
utterances: There are many gods to be worshiped here.  I wonder if people come here to benefit the gods, or just themselves?

npcs.name: Ulmar Mul'veem
utterances: You should leave here.  Do not wake the sleeping one.
It is not to protect him.  It is to protect others.  His sleep is not natural, and has proven dangerous to our own colleagues who attempted to discern what was keeping him from waking.

That is correct.  When they fell asleep, their movements and even their breathing seemed to match his.  We were able to move those that slumbered in this way without falling asleep ourselves, but touching Thumore always produces the same result.  I fear he may be beyond aid.

We pondered that possibility, but none have awoken since they fell into the slumber.  It's not worth sacrificing anyone else to attempt to verify that theory, so we can't be certain exactly what it is that's happening.  We theorize that they are entering the same dream that he is in.
You can't be thinking about trying to enter the dream yourself, can you?  We have no idea what is actually happening!  It's possible that we might never be able to wake you again!
That's very true.  But what do you hope to accomplish?  What is it you're going to do once you enter the dream?

Well, I'm not going attempt to talk you out of it any further, if your desire is truly to end up as our other researchers.  Although this might be the only way to help Thumore, I urge you to consider what you're doing.

npcs.name: Ulthus Greygore
utterances: The best dreams are the flashbacks of the battlefield.
In war there is no room for fear.
Make war not love.
Armor could be useful. But I've never needed it.
Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.
Too many so-called-entrepreneurs are uncomfortable with the cost of doing business.

npcs.name: Valencia Rhein
utterances: "House trained?" What's that mean?

npcs.name: Vare Smothers
utterances: Oi there! You think you are a crafter, do you?
So, you can make items, but how good a grasp do you have of the basics?
That's all well and good, but I mean the true basics. Getting your hands dirty grubbing in the soil for the resources needed in crafting.

Pfaugh, he is an amateur extortionist. No, though he does have a point. Before you can truly understand your craft and call yourself a true crafter, you need to understand every step of the process, the first of which is understanding your resources.
Hah! Are you afraid to get your hands dirty? Not so sure you are a true crafter?
Now is your chance to prove it. You will not ever be truly considered a grandmaster artisan without proving that you have a firm understanding of the basics.
I can promise that I will only request this of you once, and then you are done with me.

The where is totally up to you. If it can be harvested, grab it. Variety is good, but make sure to grab some actually resources that you can use in there, eh? Otherwise, you are just a harvester, not a crafter.

We want true proof of your skill and determination, not mere dabbling, mind you. However, you have until the end of the year before I leave the lands, which should leave you plenty of time to harvest a chunk here, and a chunk there.

npcs.name: Vassi Darkscale
utterances: Vassi does not like the looks of you.  Please move out of his view so he may continue to enjoy it.

npcs.name: Velna T`Kril
utterances: The Overlord commands me to work the night shift and so I must accept.

npcs.name: Vhishall
utterances: We don't sell contraband furnishings in our shop.  We sell only pieces approved by the Overlord!
Don't be ashamed, friend.  We have pieces that even ratongas can afford!
Please don't touch anything.  This isn't a museum. If you break it, you buy it!

npcs.name: Vibia Valens
utterances: Please take a look at my wares. Don't hesitate to ask me any questions.

You're in luck. It just so happens that I need someone like you; someone who's not afraid of a few ghost stories.  I need you to acquire some important items for me. I'll pay you, of course. Interested?

Old legends say that the caverns are haunted.  It's all superstitious rubbish, of course!  The way everyone cowers in fear at the mention of the caves, you'd think they'd never heard of the walking dead before those silly legends!
I'm talking about the Wailing Caves. What other haunted caverns are there?  Despite the rumors you may have heard, the caverns are no more haunted than the savannah.
Precisely!  I need someone to venture into the caverns and gather a few ingredients for me.  The task shouldn't be too difficult for someone like you.

Oh, just a bit of seep bile from a primordial and the venom sac of a rare spider called Soulspike. Hardly a worthy task for one with such ... worldly experience, but still, I humble myself to ask for your services.

Soulspike is a Wailing Spider, one of the species that live in the caverns; he's a bit larger than the rest. His venom is said to be incredibly potent, though encountering Soulspike is extremely rare. Still, nothing for a brave adventurer to fear.
A client of mine has requested a very... interesting potion from me.  Of course I'm more than capable of brewing it, but only if I have those ingredients.  So, are you interested in the job?

npcs.name: Vissa D`Dbth
utterances: You have learned how to gather harvests, and whether or not you decide to learn a tradeskill profession, you'll find harvesting can be a useful and profitable pastime.  Are you interested in reviewing the crafting process?

All right, let's learn about the crafting process itself.  You'll need to have some harvested elm, tin, and roots in your bags.  Shall I tell you a bit more about the crafting stations and your tradeskill arts, or do you want to just get going?

There are a number of different crafting stations that can be used to make different items.  For example, you would use a forge to make metal armor, and a chemistry table to make potions.  The other crafting stations are:  the sewing table, the woodworking table, the sage's engraved desk, the stove & keg, and the jeweler's workbench.

Each of the 9 tradeskill professions has its own 6 tradeskill arts, and there are also a couple of special arts that are used for recipes not related directly to one tradeskill specialty. The appropriate arts will appear as buttons at the bottom of the crafting window when you start to make an item.

That's right. If you mouse-over or examine the arts in your book, you should see what each of them do.  Three will add progress, and three will add durability.  When you're crafting you will want to be sure you know which ones add progress and which ones add durability. If you're having trouble maintaining durability, use all your durability arts all the time!  Or to speed up progress, use the progress arts nonstop.

The first step in crafting anything is the recipe.  The recipe you select determines what you will create.  Open your recipe book from the main menu, or press N, to see yours.  If you're new to crafting it will be empty, but as you gain more recipes they will be listed here and you can use the Search box at the top of this window to easily find recipe names.  You can also create custom filters using the Edit button.

In this window you would select the name of the recipe you wish to use and then click Create.  You will need to be near a crafting station of the appropriate type.  If you click on the crafting station directly, your recipe book will automatically filter to show you only the recipes you can make on that station.  Once you click Create, you will move to the Resource Window which shows you the list of ingredients that recipe requires.  If you have all those, you click Begin and crafting starts.

I'd like you to make a candelabra for practice. While you craft it, I'd like you to pay attention to the blue and green bars in the middle area.  This shows you your progress (blue), and the durability (green) of the item you are creating.  The goal is to increase your progress without losing too much durability.  To create the item, you need to fill all four blue progress bars.  If you lose at least one full bar of durability, you will not be able to do this unless you can regain that durability again.   It is safest to keep your durability near maximum just in case of unexpected critical failures.

That's where the reaction arts I mentioned come in.  You can use these to add progress (blue) or durability (green). Mouse click these or press 1 through 6 on your keyboard.  You can use these skills proactively throughout crafting to influence the outcome - for example, use skills that add durability if your durability is dropping.  Every 4 seconds a crafting 'round' completes and you will see numbers indicating your overall progress and durability loss or gain for that round above the crafting station.  This is generally easier to see in third-person view (use your mouse wheel to scroll out).

Of course, it'll be easier to understand once you can see it in action.  Here's a recipe book, and some fuel.  Scribe the recipe book by finding it in your inventory and right-clicking it.  Check that you have some elm, tin, and roots in your bags, and head over to the forge.  Click on the forge to bring up your recipe list, and select the recipe for the simple candelabra.

Moving on to the next lesson, you should be aware that there are some hazards associated with crafting.  Why, back in the old days, it wasn't unusual to see piles of injured bodies beside the forge!  We've managed to build slightly less dangerous forges since then, but no matter what craft you choose, there are still dangers to counter.

During the crafting process, you will sometimes see a warning icon appear in the area below the four progress bars.  The warning icon will match one of your reaction art icons, and will have a name indicating the type of danger. The crafter can correct these problems by ensuring the next reaction art they use matches the icon of the warning.  Successfully doing so will avoid bad things occurring (such as a loss of progress, or durability, or even injury to the crafter) and may also result in unusually good things happening (such as progress or durability gain, a skill bonus, or even the discovery of a rare harvest).

No, that was a particularly easy recipe.  In most other cases though, you have the chance of these warnings appearing.  They're random, but will always occur at the beginning of a new crafting round.  You have until the end of that 4 second round to counter the event.  I'd like you to go to the jeweler's workbench now and create a lead bracelet.  You'll find the recipe in this book.  Take care this time to watch out for warnings and counter them correctly.  And don't forget you can also use your arts to help out even when there's no warning showing.

Well done, I hope you avoided any serious injuries.  So, now you know the basics of crafting, and I hope you understand how to obtain the best quality results while avoiding injury.  Now, would you like to try a few more recipes to learn about the nine types of tradeskill you can specialize in?

Well, let's see.  You've made a candelabra using the carpenter skills, and learned that carpenters make items that can be placed in houses.  Carpenters also make strong boxes for storage, and sales containers for selling items to others.  You've also made a bracelet: jewelers make jewelry like this, and they also make combat art upgrades for scout types.

Now why don't you try your hand at provisioning, and make some jum jum cider?  Food and drink help an adventurer's power and health to regenerate faster between battles, so a provisioner's goods are always in demand.  You'll need some harvested jum jum, and some liquid, which the fuel merchant will sell (aerated mineral water works just fine, and adds that extra fizz).

Next we'll look at weapons.  These can be made by both weaponsmiths and woodworkers.  Weaponsmiths are masters of metallic weaponry including swords, axes, daggers, and hammers.  Woodworkers are skilled at working with wood, creating wooden weapons such as staffs, batons, and cudgels, as well as bows and arrows and wooden bucklers and round shields for the defense of their allies.  They also craft powerful totems that possess restorative properties.  Practice both crafts by making a tin hand axe, and an elm greatstaff.

Sages possess an unsurpassed knowledge of the arcane.  They apply this knowledge by scribing spells onto scrolls that increase the might of healers and mages.  Create a Scroll of Shackle and bring it to me.

Excellent work.  Now let's look at alchemists; they create deadly poisons and magic potions from almost any material, benign or otherwise.  These concoctions provide benefits in battle, such as healing, resistance, or extra damage against a foe.  Alchemists also make combat art upgrades for fighter types to improve their abilities in battle.  Make me an Essence of Intercept to practice these skills.

Now let's look at tailors and armorers.  Armorers focus on heavy plate and chain armor, while tailors specialize in the creation of lighter cloth and leather armor.  Tailors also make backpacks and other items from cloth or leather.  Show me that you can create a tin chainmail coat, and a rawhide backpack.

Excellent work!  I hope you now have an idea of what each tradeskill class does, and how to do it.  At level 9 you'll need to decide which crafting path you will follow, by speaking to the Crafting Trainer near your local tradeskill area.  The Crafting Trainer also sells your recipe books, so be sure to pick those up!  Come back to me at any time and I'll be happy to give you refreshers on this information.  Should you choose to continue a career as a crafter, I wish you the best of fortune!
Hello, friend!  I'm here to teach interested people a little bit about how to harvest crafting materials, and how to craft tradeskilled items.  Are you interested?

Harvesting resources tend to be segregated by areas - for example, you'll be able to harvest items (often also called nodes) for making equipment for level 1-9 adventurers, in the same areas where you'll find level 1-9 adventurers hunting.  There are seven types of harvestable item:  wood, roots, ore, soft metal, animal dens, shrubs, and fish.  I'd like you to get a few harvests from each type of harvestable item.

npcs.name: Vivian Matho
utterances: Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?
All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Vixxi Starguide
utterances: Good day to you.
Really?!  How exciting!  Has my perfect match been found, yet?
Oh.  So, no luck finding a handsome, muscled man that wants to spend time with me?  I tell ya, a pair of broad shoulders walks by, and my knees buckle.
Well, yeah.  Oh, is that wrong?  Should I say something more brainy?  I care about the poor and map-less, too.

npcs.name: Vulture
utterances: Target set!
Letting fly!
Can't you see I'm trying to concentrate!

npcs.name: Vzell
utterances: The Grand Inquisitor speaks for Sir Lucan in all matters regarding the Dismal Rage.

npcs.name: Weaponsmith Xass
utterances: I am the finest weaponsmith in Freeport... But I don't do public work anymore. These days I simply make new designs for the sake of advancing my craft... and the occasional very pricey contract.

npcs.name: a weary Kor shaman
utterances: Please help me... hear my story and offer me succor.

npcs.name: Whisper
utterances: The Overlord pays us quite well for our expertise.
Jackal knows where you are at all times.

npcs.name: William Hille
utterances: Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?
The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: a woken spirit
utterances: Why have you woken me from my slumber?
You wish to battle? Are you sure?
You DARED to disturb my rest, now you must battle me!
Not for me. Not in life or in the afterlife! Now fight!

npcs.name: a wonderstruck Freeport dweller
utterances: We owe the Overlord a great deal.
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
See! We never needed Qeynos' help! The Overlord can do it all on his own!
Let the weak Qeynosians rot.
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Freeport can't accomplish!
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, the Overlord would save us.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
Luclin shines so bright...
We must not doubt our Overlord. We owe much to his leadership!
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Freeport still stands.

npcs.name: Wozur Headsplitter
utterances: The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: Xeuxa Foamheart
utterances: What brings you to the Temple of War, <player name>?

npcs.name: Zafira
utterances: If you are looking for Captain Stovka and the rest of the crews, they are down at the Seafarer's Roost in East Freeport. In the meantime, want to buy something?

npcs.name: Zagokk Skinflayer
utterances: Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?

npcs.name: Zak Silvanus
utterances: Hail, <player name>.  What can I do for ya?

Ah, yes.  Those Disciples of Love are always thinking that I could do with someone in my life.  But to tell you the truth, I've kinda written 'em all off.  I've found hard work and physical labor more rewarding.
Sure there was.  She was colder than a Frost Giant!
Hmm. Figures change, but the soul never does.  It may sound sappy, but it's the soul and personality that attract me most.

npcs.name: Zargga
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Zaveda X'vch
utterances: Why do your vacant expression and those filthy clothes seem familiar to me? Ah, yes. You're the one that acquired the Fallen Gate Key for Kanos. I remember him pointing you out as you crossed this way a few days past.

Good, you remember then. This city has a reputation of making people forget. If I'd have judged you by your shabby clothes, and that horrid stench that seemed to follow you as you crossed my way, I would have thought you a vagrant drunkard.  I am... surprised this city has not yet squelched what little intelligence you have left.

As you may well remember, you promised to do more work for Kanos. And if I were you, I'd keep that promise, as the last whelp that lied to him is now... shall we say... having a hard time being found...

Silence, fool! We have discovered that a Thexian Wizard has knowledge of Kanos's excursions to the Fallen Gate. This information cannot get out, as it could damage his reputation within the Freeport Militia.

They would normally ignore ranting from Thexian scum.  However, this Wizard has gained notoriety by bribing the militia. They may be more apt to listen to him than the other vermin who are trading rumors for gold.

Listen closely. The wizard and three unknown Dark Elves were last seen entering the Fallen Gate, this being more than a week ago. The inhabitants of the city may have already done part of your job, and that is, of course, assassinating the wizard and his traveling companions...

Very well, I... will ... go ... slow... I know that ratonga-sized brain of yours has problems memorizing detailed tasks. Ready?... Kanos wants you to go to the Fallen Gate and find any clues as to the whereabouts of the wizard and his lapdogs...
Find out how that wretched wizard learned of Kanos's visits to the city...

And lastly, bring back proof of the party's demise. I don't care if they were dead when you got to them, or if you personally slit each of their throats, but bring back an item from their corpses, so that I know this problem has been solved.

npcs.name: Zizwold
utterances: Finally! You've arrived!  Take this and go quickly!  Remember, gather the items exactly as I've specified on the list!  Do not compromise with the quality!  Now, I don't want to hear anything about payment until you've returned!
It's the list of the items I need to fulfill your master's commission!  What else could I possibly be giving you?! Off with you!

npcs.name: Zur
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
